title: Beautiful Zoo and view of the Nainital Lake
review: This zoo is built on the incline of the mountain hence it feels like hiking when you walk through hence keep at least 2 hrs at hand for this point. Got a very close view of the tigers, the white peafowl and the red panda were a treat to watch. My little one thoroughly enjoyed every bit of this visit.

title: Zoo
review: It’s a nice place to spend time when you are around Nainital.

title: Avoidable visit
review: I had been planning to visit the zoo just to see the Red Panda, and I was able to see them. Issue is you need to hire a common cab to reach on the hill top which is a scam, cost pp Rs.50 for cramped ride. Then you need take a walk for arnd 400 mtrs to reach the zoo entrance and buy a ticket for Rs.100 each. There is a further steep walk to see the limited variety ofbirds/animals in the zoo which can be seen anywhere in India at a reasonable price. The two star are just because you can see a rare Red Panda nothing else...!

title: one of its kind in the state
review: High Altitude Zoo or Nainital Zoo, a one of its kind in the state, is home to several wildlife species like Siberian Tiger, Snow Leopard, Himalayan Black Bear, Goral, Himalayan Martin, and Tibetan Wolf.

title: Beautiful  zoo at Nainital.High altitude.
review: We visited  this zoo in December,  2018. It's  located high on top of the hills.Private cars r not allowed  to go up. Taxis will take u up to a point. After that, u have to walk uphill on the road for quite a distance. There r benches and guard rails. I would advice  only the physically  fit people  to go there. Lots of birds and animals r there. The star attractions  r the Red Pandas, a Bengal tiger and leopards. Everywhere  u have to climb steep stairs.View is magnificent  from there. U can see entire nainital  town and the lake. Most important  is your physical  fitness for the long strenuous  climb.

title: Zoo with a difference .
review: Visited on insistence of kids . The zoo is the first high altitude zoo I have visited . Takes a lot of  effort with the climbing and walking invoved.  If possible , it should have some way to make it  more aged friendly or may be zoo's are for youngsters.  The sight of Red Panda , Mountain Goat , Blue Sheep were exciting.

title: Too much to walk.
review: Though we had to walk too much but after reaching its worth to walk as you can see wild animals like tiger leopards etc but the place is quite good and good for childrens.

title: Nainital Zoo is the famous destination for wildlife lovers
review: Nainital Zoo is the Nainital Zoo is the famous destination for wildlife lovers in Nainital & one of the well-maintained Zoos in Uttarakhand. The famous Zoo is situated in the hills which is known as Shar- Ka-Danda & just 1 Km far from Tallital Bus Stand, also known as Govind Ballabh Pant Zoo. The Zoo is covered with the area of 4.693 Hectares & 2100 Meters above the sea level. A zoo is the Habitat of numerous Himalayan species such as Snow Leopard, Himalayan Black Bear, Siberian Tiger, Wolf, Hill Fox, Owl Eagle & many more. in Nainital & one of the well-maintained Zoos in Uttarakhand. The famous Zoo is situated in the hills which are known as Shar- Ka-Danda & just 1 Km far from Tallital Bus Stand, also known as Govind Ballabh Pant Zoo. The Zoo is covered with the area of 4.693 Hectares & 2100 Meters above the sea level. A zoo is the Habitat of numerous Himalayan species such as Snow Leopard, Himalayan Black Bear, Siberian Tiger, Wolf, Hill Fox, Owl Eagle & many more.

title: Don’t Visit Nainital Zoo
review: This is not a place for young kids, elderly, or anyone with medical issues. First, you have to take a Zoo contracted taxi to drive upto th e hill where Zoo is located. This costs 60 rupees per person. The taxi drops you approximately one kilometer before the Zoo gate. You have to climb/ walk steep road to get to the Zoo gate and ticket office. The entrance fee is 100 rupees per person. Then again there is steep climbs and stairs to see each animal. The collection of animals is very ordinary and nothing to write home about. Most kids and elderly can hardly make few steps inside the gate before they are exhausted. We went and returned disappointed only after seeing few peasants birds. My advice is not to visit Nainital Zoo. Go and use your time and money to see other things in Nainital. If you live in a city then you have better options to visit very good Zoo in your city.

title: Tiresome yet awesome
review: You have to take share cab from the mall road to reachnear the zoo. It is the highest altitude zoo in Asia and you have to walk quite a distance uphill. Animals are in good health.  There is a small cafe beside it.

title: Family Holiday
review: Zoo is situated at very high altitude. Not advisable for elderly people . Long walk and climb to see. plus point zoo is well maintained in cleaniness

title: Good place for kids
review: Nice clean zoo for kids. Got decent section of animals specially tigers , leopards and lots of birds. Path leading to the animals are quite equate steep and has a lot of steps, so be prepared.

title: Great experience.
review: Though the place is too high to walk but its just worth of going the Leopord tiger everyone is available. we had seen Red panda sambhar dear and many other animals here.

title: Nice zoo
review: Versatile collection of animals especially tigers,leopards,birds.My daughter enjoyed the visit.

title: One of the best Zoo in North India
review: We enjoyed the Zoo except for the climb from where the car drops you. The animals in the zoo are very exciting. The tigers there are the highlight and so are the leopards. Must visit place when in Nainital.

title: High altitude zoo
review: The surprising thing is that it's at a very high altitude, and it's maintained decently. The trek is nice though it is a little steep and narrow, it's a problem to take a car there so I suggest you walk.

title: Ok for a morning
review: Nit very big and can be covered in a morning. They have some nice high altitude species like the snow leopard mountain goat Himalayan Minal etc. if yiu have a morning free in the nainital area surely worth the visit

title: Zoooo
review: You need to catch a cab for 60 rs from mall road and that’ll drop u right outside the zoo.

title: Full of attitude
review: Zoo is very beautiful. There are many animals that are worth seeing. Attitude of all animals liked me very much. Don't think twice and go fir it.

title: Must visit
review: It is a great place to visit in nainital. The day was filled with fun, masti and adventure. It feels great to roam in the zoo. Got to see many new species of birds and animals.

title: Closely see wild life
review: Ready to go up hills lots of walking in hill required to see.

title: Nice and beautiful
review: This is a high altitude zoo. Not too big but worth  a visit. Not far from mall road. can be covered in 1-2 hours. timing 10AM-5PM

title: Zoo is ok but view is nice
review: Zoo is ok but place is nice. It is on mountain not safe for small kids and for senior citizens. Nice animals and healthy. they have one tiger  some deers leopards  birds  . Please cary water and head covers.

title: Zoo with steep roads
review: This zoo is situated at a height. Once inside walking around is not easy as there are steep slopes and multiple steps. It has a good collection of animals like Tiger, panther, red panda, deer, fowls etc. Kids will really enjoy it. One has to avail a shuttle service to reach the spot and then climb 150m at a gradient to arrive at the ticket counter.

title: Not  good for old people and small kids
review: First of all , there are 5 people at entry gate, which were really rude.this place is not for old people and kids. The roads are really steep.i paid for my mom and uncle but waste of money. They have to come back and ticket is not refundable.the money they wrote on website was 50 rupees but they charge 100.the bear cage is very low. Ydou never know , what gonna happened , if bear get angry.

title: The Zoo that you must visit
review: I have never seen a zoo in India which is so well maintained and so serene. Animals here look healthy and happy, best part is the tigers and leopards which you can see up and close. It is must visit place if you are travelling with kids.

title: Best Maintained Zoo
review: This High altitude zoo needs certain level of physical fitness if one intends to cover the entire zoo, its not too vast but well segregated and neatly maintained. The access- its located up a steep hillock that one needs to climb or hire a Shuttle by paying Rs 59 per head, ramshackle MUV's shall then take you close to Zoo entrance and also bring them back to ground level post ones Zoo visit. One needs to walk jup further 100 mtrs steep incline to reach the ticket counter panting. Tiger, leopard and Himalayan Bears are the star attractions along with Red Pandas. The tiger was a bit moody when we visited, sulking inside its hut, but our 30 mins wait was worth it once it stepped out, what a sight !!! one will be mesmerized to see Tiger so up close, its sheer bulk is over awing. Leopard was in a playful mood and we got a good dekho at it as well, over all its worth paying Rs 100/head and spending 90 mins in refreshing, not-stinking zoo environs. Kind of soothed our disappointment of not being able to sight a tiger at Corbett reserve the previous day.

title: Thrilling...
review: When you are in nainital this is the place must be in your bucket list... If you find Mr. Kamal at this place he is very jolly person

title: Wonderful scenaarios
review: Zoo is located at the tip of a small mountain. It gives a very nice view of nainital and other hills. The zoo is so clean and well maintained. You can see tigers and cheetahs in a hand touch distance. Worth for your money and if you are a nature lover along with animal lover, it is a must visit place in nainital.  But it has less beings when compared with other famous zoos.

title: good experience
review: the Zoo Is located at very height. you will get shuttle service from India hotel on Mall road you have to get ticket for the ride and wait for your number. little crowded but 5 minute ride.

title: Nice zoo
review: A good place for hanging out with family. Got to see many different animals and birds. The zoo is well maintained

title: The beat
review: One of the best Zoo I have been to. The key to this place is that it is located on one of highest peaks of the town Nainital which offers picturesque views of the town. The animals are kept in there natural habitats inside the zoo and all of them looked well fed & healthy. A must visit of in Nainital.

title: Great experience of high alltitude zoo.
review: we visited this zoo on 7th july 2018. the place is located on the top of hill. the shuttle service is offered from the road to upper side of hill (taxi) the shuttle service of taxi starts from mall road near hotel INDIAN they take rs40/person too n fro. after the taxi drops us we have to climb a steep road for say 5min. after reaching the zoo one has take the entry ticket of 100rs. young people can enjoy the zoo to its fullest. but sorry to say the old people or the people having leg problems n heart problems they may find it difficult to see the whole zoo. animals here are mainly the tiger , wolf , leopard , himalayan black bear, deers, mountain goats, red panda and birds.

title: Nanital Zoo
review: very well built and maintained. animal and birds looks so good strong and clean.

title: Short steep Up n Down hike with bird eye view of nainital
review: We went in rainy season and the greenery that time  had its own charm.Point of attraction is the royal Bengal tiger and the closeup view of the tiger is trully exciting.the whole zoo is carved on a single mountain so going up and down to view different species is a daunting task but the zoo is rather small and the whole trip can be finished withing 3-4hours.There are benches available at frequent intervals to rest.Food items are strictly prohibited,the  fine being rs2000 and the cleanliness is apparent which adds to the beauty of the zoo.Restaurants are there before entering the zoo so get ur fill before entering.Water is allowed inside.

title: Zoo with high altitude animals
review: A big zoo amid mountains with a lot of mountain animals.

title: Must visit place with kida
review: Will have walk very much avoid if you are with old parents. Kids enjoyed the place. Good view of Nainital city'

title: Very nice zoo
review: This is a small zoo located in nainital but very selective and nicely maintained .. large variety of birds were there along with the other animals.. my daughter enjoyed alot

title: Best zoo a must visit
review: Well maintained zoo with lots of rare animals. They had 5 jaguars in a cage which was a sight to see. Rest tigers bears Pandas deers and lot more. The zoo premise was neat and well maintained.

title: Ultimate
review: Very different type of zoo in the world situated very high in the city of Nainital and inside the zoo is also high and high and high

title: Excellent place.. Lot of climbing though
review: Although you have to climb a lot, don't miss this place. The zoo is located on a mountain, with animals such as leopard, tiger, red panda, parrots, peacocks, etc. As you have to climb a lot after main entrance, pls do avail of shuttle service from mall road.

title: Nice Zoo!!
review: This zoo is really at very high altitude!!  It is very neat, clean and also properly organized. You can take a local transport to reach the zoo from the Nanital lake or you can walk to the zoo (you really require good amount of stamina).

title: It’s good but not worth the wait
review: AVOID WEEKEND ! If you are visiting on weekend i will not recommend to visit there; its very crowed and you have to wait approx 2-3 hour just to enter the gate; starting from waiting for the jeep to take you to the zoo; however if you wanna walk its 30 min walking vertical.

title: Good place for kids
review: Good place for kids but only problem is waiting time for going up as it is a steep climb. Again after reaching up it is a small steep climb to the top. Wont recommend to old and infirm as it can be a little stress for the steep climb.

title: Steep climb!
review: Has a shuttle option from Hotel India on the Mall road , very crowded during season and not a very big place , has a small collection of animals n birds not a very big place , steep climb so if not a hug fan of walking and animals do avoid , takes about an hour minimum to cover the entire places

title: Zoo at the hill top
review: If you are animal lover, have visited many zoos then it is not a must visit zoo for you. This is a small zoo at the hill top where one can spend some time while walking through stiff slope. A tiger, few birds, butterfly etc are there to entertain specially the children. The place can not be reached by personal car, zeal’s are available on sharing basis .

title: Go only for the Tiger
review: This zoo is at high altitude. You have to queue up for a taxi ride to reach here. Once you reach there is a upward climb for 200 meters. The zoo inside is a climb as well. The biggest attraction is the Tiger visit only for that reason. You can avoid as there is nothing much out there.

title: Most worst experience of life
review: We have visited Zoo with family and kids.... Road to zoo is most dangerous and  risky....... After park your vehicle... then you have to walk about 2 km on high peak road,, when you reach zoo you feel cheated... Nothing to see  ( only common animals like bear, dear, monkey and some birds) .....don't go if you have any medical problem and issues......

title: Small but Nice Zoo
review: Certainly a different kind of zoo experience. Number of different and  rare bird species, tiger, deer, beer and pandas  etc, well maintained and planed.

title: Most surprising place of our Nainital trip
review: Nainitaal is famous for lake, mountains etc. but to our utter surprise this zoo is a very good place to visit actually its a must visit attraction.

title: Good zoo
review: This is very well maintained zoo. You have to visit through jeep to this place. One should required some extra fittness to visit this zoo. Animal of this zoo are very healthy.

title: must visit
review: though slightly at height but is worth it. beautiful layout and good experience with some animals. you can find tiger moving around or red panda playing or peacock dancing with feathers open

title: Worth the visit
review: Well maintained and situation amidst the mountains with quite a lot to see makes it a must visit. There is quite a lot of area to cover Incase you wish to see all of it, would recommend only if you're ok with a little bit of a workout.

title: Only zoo in uttrakhand
review: This zoo popularly known as sher ka danda,it has ticket for rs 50 for adults and rs 25 for kids,it is closed on manday.

title: just a zoo
review: good in the sense that it is better then other so called zoo's in india ..though some are great not talking about that ...

title: A regular Zoo, but nicely maintained.
review: This Zoo is one of the highest altitude zoos. Reaching here is a task in itself. You have an option of walking there or driving your own vehicle (which is not recommended though, because of steep slope). There is an option of going by the taxi which is available from Mall road. The taxis take Rs. 40 per person (to & fro) and take you there. The entry fee to the Zoo is around Rs. 100. Lot of exotic animals and birds are there in enclosures. You can spend an hour or two here and enjoy it.

title: Truly great
review: The beauty and location are just great .the trip to Nainital is incomplete without visiting the zoo.

title: Truely a High Altitude Zoo...Phew!!!
review: For a visit to this zoo you need to take a shuttle from near Hotel India which takes you to a certain point of the hill and then you need to ascend a bit more to reach the main gate of the zoo where you can buy tickets. The main attractions of this Zoo- A Bengal tiger, Tibetan Wolves, Leopards, Himalayan Bears and Deers along with variety of birds. To see all of them you need to move higher stepwise. It is definitely a good experience although a bit tiring for all of us...;)

title: Amazing
review: I would rate a 4 * to this zoo. Very well kept and maint with huge no of species to see. One can see the Tiger and Leopards in almost natural habitats.

title: An average zoo
review: We were a big group consisting of nearly all age people. One has to climb considerably to view all  birds & animals.I found this zoo as an ordinary zoo.It is advisable for seniors to visit depending their stamina as you stop halfway, you won't miss much.The youngsters who climbed upto last could see a white peacock.

title: Well maintained
review: The Zoo and the entire property is very well maintained by the authorities. The place is close to the Nainital lake but you will have to drive uphill to reach it.

title: Good informative place
review: I visited the zoo with my family but was quite tired as we went to the zoo on foot by climbing a steep 2 km walk as there was no taxi available due to heavy rush. The zoo was clean and I think the authorities are taking good care of the animals inside as by looking at them they were quite healthy.

title: Nice zoo but not for elderly
review: It has beautiful and healthy animals.

title: Good scenic view
review: Only for the fit. After the starting point which itself is a good climb. The zoo is all uphill. Tigers , leopards, bear fun for kids. But got out of breath so couldnt see the full zoo. A little tiring. But one of must visit sites.

title: Worth to visit
review: If you have couple of hours  in Nainital and won't mind walking on steep slopes then do visit High Nainital Zoo. Don't get demotivated for the initial few metres climbing which is really really steep from the drop point to the zoo entrance. They don't have parking space around the zoo. Better to take the shuttle from the mall road. Else it would be bit difficult to find a place to park your car.

title: Nainital Zooo
review: We have Enjyod Allot at the Zoo. it is worth visiting Have enjoyed our day and enjyod the weather. Hight altitude Zoo

title: Worth A visit
review: It has really a vast collection of wild animals. Tiger, Leopard, Wolf, Bear, hundreds of varieties of birds, dears, what else do you want ?

title: Have a fun inside . For kids and Active torist
review: Being a zoo at hilly area, its not on plane land. hence you have to move up n downs through out the zoo. All common animals are visible inside including some cold animals , panda etc.

title: High altitude zoo
review: The only zoo of uttarakhand. Nothing much to see here other then  tiger. Leopard. Some birds and deer

title: Good  view
review: Tigers , leopards, bear fun for kids. But got out of breath so couldnt see the full zoo. A little tiring. But one of must visit sites.

title: Not so great but nice
review: Situated towards tallital side. It needs steep climb on road for 15 mins to reach the zoo gate. One can grab shuttle vehicle running from mall road to parking point. Zoo entry fee is 100 INR for indians. Photography inside zoo is not allowed by tourist takes pictures by their call phones. One can see leopard, tigers, bear, deer and many more animals along with birds in this zoo. A must visit attraction and best for kids.

title: Amazing
review: Neat, clean and well organised.

title: visit to zoo was exciting
review: very well maintained zoo, nice to see birds of different types, dears, , tigers,and a wonderful natural beauty. of course climbing will make you tired.

title: A nice place for Children and Families
review: Located on the top of the hill top you can come to this place either by taxi or walk.I would personally recommend walking though it's a steep walk but enjoyable.The place has good variety of wild cats particularly the Snow leopard and tiger .The Siberian Tiger which was a special attraction of the place is no more but new cats have been added.Aprt from Wild cats one can also see several pheasants which are found only in the upper Himalayan ranges.Over all a good place to visit educate children and enjoy a great view of the Talk from here.

title: Decent zoo but requires lots of hike.
review: zoo is created on slope , so it requires lots of hike if you want to visit every animal. Not suitable for old and young children. Pregnant ladies the and parents carrying the toddler in arms should avoid this.

title: Must visit place of Nainital
review: If you are in couple or family with young children then this is must visit place of Nainital. Here you can see beautiful wild life and also from here there is amazing view of Nainital city.

title: Zoo at the peak
review: We visited Nainital zoo at the month end(May,2018) and it was amazing. The view too was great and one requires a lot stamina to see the entire zoo as it's inclined...

title: Excellent place, must visit in Nainital
review: Excellently maintained zoo, clean and organized with pathways marked with arrows so that you can follow the optimum path to cover all enclosures. Has a limited number of species of animals, but most animals endemic to the Himalayan mountains like Red Panda, Himalayan black bear, Blue sheep which you don't get to see in regular zoos. Also has tiger, leopard, peafowl, pheasants and some other birds. The zoo located at a high altitude, needs around 300-400 m of uphill trekking to reach the entrance and some climbing inside the zoo to see each enclosure.

title: Excellent
review: The high altitude zoo is must visit place in nainital. There is variety of animals and birds ranging tigers, leopards, red panda, white peacock etc. But since the zoo is located on high altitude it requires considerable walking and good stamina. Not recommended for people having knee problems

title: Zoo at Hills
review: If at Nainital, Zoo requires your attention by paying a visit. Just paying an INR 40 each the organisers will pick you up from Mall Road ( Next to Naini Lake and Opp India Hotel) and drop at Zoo by their vehicle, once you are done they will drop you back to the origin, Please keep the ticket handy with you. Since its on straight height and top of mountain at Nainital gives you the beautiful eagle eye view of the city including Naini Lake etc. At entrance of Zoo you are required to buy tickets worth an INR 100 each for adults. We were so excited to peak in almost every cage but straight height forced us to stay back after few minutes, However the young teenagers traveling with us completed the entire round of Zoo on our behalf. It's also an ideal place to click nice and beautiful selfies/ pictures, it's also offers a restaurant, washroom and shopping souvenirs etc

title: The best place a High Altitude Zoo
review: Enjoyed Zoo. A very nice and clean zoo, a good place for kids and family. Though there is not too much variety of animals but still you see some different species like red panda and beautiful birds. It's big and at a very high altitude so you have to trek all the way. The best place for youngs.

title: Nainital ZOO
review: Perfect place for kids to enjoy, there is a lot of climbing but it's worth it. Got a glimpse of all the animals on offer.

title: Lots of animals and birds
review: Overall very good experince in d zoo. Have to walk bt worth the experince. Clean and spacious. Saw many animals like tiger bear deer leopards pandas.worth taking children to this place.

title: Good to go
review: If you are fit, then you have to visit this place, first High altitude zoo seen in my life, super experience, also seen panda there

title: Literally at high altitude!
review: There is a shuttle service upto entry of the zoo which helps you to save 1.5 kms of walk to the hill. From there again the visitors have to walk/climb on slope a lot to see the animals.

title: Excellent and well kept zoo. Getting there is difficult as steep road to climb
review: We visited the zoo on 20th March with our 2 yr old daughter. You would have to buy zoo shuttle tickets Rs. 40 per head for up and down journey (Children below 2 yrs are free). Better reach there early. Zoo opens from 10AM. Shuttle will drop you to a point. After that, it is steep climb for about 10 mins to reach the zoo ticket counter. Ticket is 100 per head for adult and 50 for child. No food items allowed within the zoo. Zoo is very good with lot of animals inside - Tiger, Leopard, Bear, Deer, Red Panda, Birds, Wolf, Peacock. But the roads are very steep. So, it will take almost 2 hours to complete the entire zoo premises. Keep water bottles handy. There is also a children park and a food court but we didn't go there.

title: Go for it
review: Excellent and attractive zoo they gave build up on top of the hills. You have to par 100 INR PP and 40 PP for pick and drop from mall road.

title: Zoo in the hill
review: the best part is that the zoo is situated in the hill. so you have to climb up to see tiger. then climb further to see bear. now you realise that you left lepard which is down below and in the different track. it is small but nice.

title: Difficult to Climb but worth to visit
review: Nainital Zoo is on really high altitude. You need to take shuttle service from Mall road, which takes you to Vehicle point, from there need to climb some distance, it really checks your stamina. Have many species of animals (Including Royal Bengal Tiger) and Birds. Children may enjoy a lot. Worth to visit

title: Test for your stamina
review: First things first, please visit the zoo if you love travelling and have enough stamina. It's not for lazy people who will nag that such a climb was not worth it. Your rented car will not be able to take you here as the municipality have car service to transport tourists on a charge of 40 rupees per head. That includes both to and from trips. It's kinda nuisance because while returning you have to wait some time for your turns as there are only a few cars. The zoo itself is very well maintained and clean with coffee shops available to refill your tummy after the climb. There are some animals which you don't usually get to see in normal city zoos. It closes at around 5pm so plan your visit accordingly. It's not a must visit but if you have time it's worth a visit but then again you need stamina and it is not very suitable for senior citizens and people with walking difficulty.

title: A Great Experience
review: Situated atop a Hill slope, the Zoo is a beautiful amalgamation of wild life experience and also land scaping besides offering a wonderful view of the Valley below. It has a number of High altitude animals including the Red Panda. A big collection of Leopards and a couple of Royal Bengal Tigers makes the couterie. A good collection of Birds are also there. But, the special treat is in the evening. around 3-4:30 pm the birds from the below valley return to their nests high up in the mountain and they pass through the Zoo; It was as if I was hit by an avalanch of Birds. A great experience!

title: Zoo
review: It is an awesome zoo. Animals are in good shape. Very good management. Staff is polite. Tiger, Red Panda, Tibetan Wolf, Monal, Blue Sheep, Cheer pheasant are the main attractions beside the natural beauty.

title: Lovely place
review: I wasn’t sure about zoo . Always felt it was for kids. But i was totally surprised with the good maintenance and upkeep of the zoo. This was the best place in nainital and i must say that i felt good that i visited this lovely place keeping my inhibitions aside.

title: Not a great zoo
review: Zoo is at a hill and you take shared ride to reach main entrance of zoo, no personal vehicle is allowed.

title: Wonderful experience
review: A wide range of animals are here from the Bengal Tiger to cute red panda and from leopard to blue sheep. All are a treat to watch but one has to shed lot of sweat to reach to each one as its on height and we need to walk walk and walk. The zoo management and staff are good.

title: Avoid going with small kids and old people
review: The zoo is situated quite far from the local sight seeing the only way to reach there is private car or the zoo has arranged cabs in which they typically stuff people . IF one is planning to visit zoo then it is advisable to book your cab seats before time.

title: Visit if you have legs
review: Zoo is located on the top hills of city, shuttle taxi run all the time from mall road charge INR 30 and entry fee 25 each,but if you want to see animals then mountain walk needed so put on sport shoes, good collection of animals specially the Red Panda and Himalayan Leopard, and good views of senic bueaty of Nainital.

title: It's a one time visit zoo, steep climb for elderly
review: If you've never been to this zoo then I would recommend to visit for once. It is at high altitude so you'll need a lots of muscle work to visit it completely. My toddler daughter enjoyed it.

title: kids just love it zoo a must on trip
review: it is located at the top and it has got good wild cats and animals and also large number of birds . kids sure love it to seem them at very close the have tiger , leopard , bear , reindeer , macaw and other species. so it worth to go for it and also at top it has good views to take photographs...

title: Overpriced
review: From 1-3-2018, the tickets for the zoo (near tallital) is Rs.100/-. There are very few animals compared to other zoos in India. The place is well kept but the price is too much. Moreover, one has to hire a taxi (Rs.40/pp to and fro) to reach the zoo (located at an altitude of 200 mtrs from mall road). Can give it a skip if less time.

title: Good Zoo
review: One of the best attraction at Nainital but you have need to go by vehicle which is fixed by Zoo authority and then you need to purchase ticket to enter the Zoo.It is not big zoo but around scenic location is very good.

title: Good zoo!!!
review: The zoo was good and excellent. My son loves this high altitude zoo. Worthy visit. Lots of animals to see.

title: Well maintained zoo
review: This place is very well maintained and there are a good amount of animals. It's in a hill and you will have to walk up-hill to see each exhibit which in a way offers a good trek as well. Kids will enjoy this place. They don't allow food inside but provide you lockers to keep your stuffs. There is no food/restaurant/shops available inside the zoo.

title: Small but well maintained
review: Its a very small zoo with a very few species of animals. Also, there are not many animals of same species. Only one kind of bird. However, its still worth visiting it. You can see the animals from very close. Bear and Red Pandas are very much visible. Its a little difficult to see Leopards and Tiger if they are sitting or seeping in any shade. You can have a close look of deer from the fence. Also, from the zoo, you can see a great view of Naini Lake and Nainital town. The only problem is you need to climb very high to reach the zoo. Shuttle service is available from the Mall at Rs. 40 per person. You can choose to walk as well. Entry fee is Rs 50/adult and Rs 20/children for Indian nationals. There are eating options also available, however, eatables are not allowed inside the zoo.

title: Visit if you have time
review: It is a steep uphill climb but the zoo is well maintained. Watch the different birds and a bear which likes to give different poses. we were able to see both tiger and leopards. Bit confusing and all uphill

title: You need to walk a lot !!
review: As name says its a high altitude Zoo so you need to be physically fit to visit this. Ferry rides are available from Mall road which will take you near Zoo ( 40 INR both side, travel time 5-7 mins). But once ferry drops you once need to climb up approx 200 meters to reach to Zoo entry and climbing doesnt end once you reach entry gate, actually entire area like that as its a located on top of hill.

title: Great
review: The zoo is very nicely maintained and the animals nicely kept. The small children enjoyed watching the animals. The entire place is very well laid out with markers guiding the visitors all along the route.

title: Amazing
review: Must watch is the Red Panda and only the Red Panda

title: must visit in nainital
review: if you ever visit nainital do not miss this amazing zoo. it feels like you are at some international zoo. the way they made it and animals too were awesome.

title: Great expereience
review: Animals in their almost natural habitat.Good way to know more about the fauna surrounding us.Many different species of birds and animals.

title: UPHILL EXCURSION
review: A zoo somewhere in the uphills of nainital. Steep slopes if you prefer walking, there is a shortcut too or else you can hire taxi then go. A very well maintained zoo having different species of birds, animals, butterflies etc. Its a very big zoo so go if you gave loads of time. Main centre of attraction are Red Panda, Tiger, leopard, stag, cheetah and some other beautifull birds. It has a variety of birds best among them a white peacock, it is very beautiful. Was wishing to see wolf and siberian tiger but they were not there. All and all its a very good zoo a pretty big one but enjoying.

title: Good collection of animal and on the top
review: It is around 500 feet above the NAINI lake and has good collection of birds and animals including bears, tigers, lions etc. They kept this place very neat and clean.

title: Zoo in the top of hill
review: G.b pant zoo at nainital. It is near the nainital lake. Here you see tiger ,bear , deer, birds, etc.

title: ENJOYABLE
review: Trip to zoo was lot of fun, specially because no private vehicles are allowed there and then the animals and birds over there. The setting is excellent and animals are kept in very environmently conditions.

title: A day in the ZOO
review: Nothing much to see but you will enjoy the path and the way the zoo was made. you have to walk too much to cover the entire zoo. The view of the lake from the top is good and also you can spot some bird species. Private vehicle not allowed to top. You have to get a jeep from the Mall Road. They give you coupon number and you have to wait till your turn comes and it is a shared Jeep.

title: The best attraction for kids
review: Though its on height and you have to walk a lot

title: just fine....better zoo in Delhi
review: If you are going with small kids  who cannot walk themselves dont go there as it's hill zoo and it will difficult to carry kids  and visit zoo

title: Worth Visit
review: Must visit...old and senior citizen need to make sure there is good walk to complete the zoo..so be prepare

title: one of the best zoo
review: It's a nice place for nature lovers and for children.Birds and animals belonging to high altitude can be seen in this zoo.One can spend here 1-2 hrs easily.

title: A treat for the kids !!
review: This is an essential trip for the kids if not for the elders also so that they get to see some of the unique species of animals like the Red Panda, the Markhor( high Altitude goat), various types of pheasants, Deer, the elusive Tiger and a number of Leapords. Some of these animals are unique to High Altitudes !! You need to take tickets for entry , ₹50/- for adults and ₹20/- for children. It can be hot during the day even in winters and advised to carry a water bottle and a cap. Be prepared to walk uphill. A snack shop is located at the starting point and you can enjoy the small eats. A souvenir shop is also located next to the ticket counter. The views of Nainital are awesome from the zoo. To reach the Zoo you need to take a cab shuttle from the Mall Road for ₹40/- per person two way. Must do with kids !!

title: Great Zoo
review: It's high and easily accessible through shared vehicles from the mall road..  Return ticket for vehicles is 40rs and zoo ticket is 50rs... You can easily watch Tiger,  Leopard and Bear...  Better to go around 10:30,  as all the animals will be roaming at that time...

title: Tedious Climb
review: On 9th Sept 2017 after taking lunch outside hotel we went to Mall road. Entry in Zoo use to close by 5 PM so, around 3 PM we took a cab which cost 80 both side. It was very difficult to climb by carrying a baby. For the first time in my life i saw a Tiger, leopard, lion, White peacock, a Big parrot and many more birds and animals. For some time there was sunshine and for sometime there was fog. It was a memorable trip.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Pt. G.B. Pant High Altitude Zoo is a high altitude zoo situated in Nainital, Uttarakhand. Established in 1984 and opened to public in 1995, it is situated on the Sher Ka Danda hill at a height of 2,100 metres (6,900 ft) above sea-level and is spread over 4.6 hectares (11 acres). It is the only High Altitude Zoo in north India, besides those in Darjeeling and Sikkim. Over the years it has become a popular tourist attraction

title: walk to a great height
review: Shuttle service is available that picks you from Alka hotel (Mall road) and drops you close to Zoo. one has to travel a lot (high altitude) to reach the zoo. Not recommended for old people.

title: DIFFERENT EXPERIENCE
review: High altitude zoo is a different experience for people from plain. Animal enclosures are at different levels so you do a lot of walking around. We could see different animals found at higher altitude and all enclosures were kept clean. Tiger was huge and never seen the one with such a big face. An educational experience for the young ones.

title: Zoo on the hills.
review: Well this is one of the things to do in Nainatal. There are a few animals and we were lucky enough to see the tiger walking up and down right in front of us. But it’s sad that these animals are caged and u can make out they are so restless. It’s also a very tedious walk so if u are with children or old parents it is definitely a pass. The zoo authorities must have special service for people over 50. If u have seen animals before it’s a pass. But if u haven’t then u must see this place.

title: Renowned Zoo
review: I went to High Altitude Zoo. It is a zoo par excellence, though, and is home to numerous fairly renowned bird, animal and other life species around most seasons of the year. Some notable creatures it houses are carnivores and predators like tigers and cheetahs, as well as exotic birds on the other end of the spectrum. It is great place to go.

title: Well maintained & must see
review: It was very well maintained and must see in your list, especially if you have young ones. Entry is from Mall Road and by local jeep which are charged Rs.70/person.

title: well maintained and exotic animals seen including tiger red panda and leopards. The bear is very playful and is a t
review: a must visit, probably the only high altitude zoo in the country. it has a steep climb to negotiate ( especially difficult for old people) to see all the animals.

title: Sad state of Animalsand birds in Nainital Zoo
review: only good thing is the high altitude and weather of Nainital in which there is no hand of zoo authorities. the animals/birds are kept in such small cabins/rooms/baadas that they can never feel happy. there's absolutely no place to open there wings to feel the air. There are singlets who have no companions to play with.

title: Good Zoo
review: Visited Amazing Place. Good zoo  some high altitude living animals worth your time to visit like red panda, some beautiful birds. One thing is that you have to climb a lot as whole zoo is in uphill site. It will tired you so visit at morning time. Photography is allowed and free. And during visit follow the yellow arrow so you will not miss any animal and easy to climb and come down, Knew about some unique animal. Lived great time.

title: Check your Stamina First 😮
review: It’s really a great place to be there. Take care of the Shuttle timing and try to catch it before lunch so that you’ll get enough time to spend up there. You can get the tickets & cab from the Mall Road.

title: Excited to see unique type of animals
review: Enjoyed to view suach a Good zoo some high altitude living animals worth your time to visit like red panda, some beautiful birds,

title: Clean and well maintained
review: This is zoo which is really clean and well maintained. Its the visitors who create nuisance at times. During our visit, we found a group of people who were throwing pebbles at the tiger to agitate it and attract its attention. They were checked by the attendants at the zoo. But it was a shame to see how we fail to appreciate something good and take pleasure in spoiling it. A must visit place for families with kids.

title: Interesting zoo
review: They have many animals which are available in high altitude areas. They have mountain wolves, red panda, different types of deer, varieties of birds, etc. All animals are kept among trees and in large enclosures. therefore, at times it takes time/ patience to spot them. We found two leopards on a high branch, camouflaged. It was good fun spotting the animals.

title: Vacation Trip
review: Hats off to the team maintain this zoo at this high altitude. Zoo has a decent variety of birds and animal included few wild ones. Me and my 4 yr kid enjoyed it thoroughly. We came across cheetah, Bear, Fox, Deers.  Not lucky to see the tigers.

title: Difficult to climb
review: It's close to the Mall Road but on a high altitude. It's a beautiful and well kept zoo, however, there are no provisions provided for senior citizens and pregnant ladies. It's very difficult to walk after 5-10 minutes and can be avoided by people suffering from some physical ailment.

title: Much Exciting Visit High Altitude Zoo at Nainital
review: It was really Worth visiting no matter how many zoos you have visited. Though small in size the zoo packs log of wild animals and birds on varying heights to test your stamina. We took around 3 hour to visit this place. To enjoy complete zoo follow the yellow mark. The zoo was very clean and gathered by nature beauty.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Located at a 15 min walk, from the mall road, the nainital zoo is world's highest altitude zoo. It is house to many birds and animals. Good place to spend time with kids or if you have some extra hours.

title: Beautiful Zoo but very difficult to reach here and come back
review: Zoo was very beautiful, many animals and birds are here. You can even adopt any animal including tiger or red panda also. Travel light because the roads here are very steep. You can have some rest for few minutes or an hour in the temple also which is present here in the zoo. Going to the zoo and coming back is really a big problem  as only few vehicles of some company are working. We have to wait for two and half hour for coming back to mall road. For the nature lovers one visit to this place is must.

title: Exciting zoo
review: All animals are full of energy. It is well maintained. Children will enjoy a lot. Many birds can also be observed. All birds are colourful. Lot of information about animals, birds and insects. Lot of knowledge about biodiversity.

title: High Altitude zoo
review: A must visit to family, friends or couples. As names suggest it is on top which you can climb if young and healthy, otherwise you can get sharing cab (40 rs) for pick/drop.

title: Superb Zoo
review: Great Place. Must see in Nainital. My son loved it. They got their own shuttle service. Private cars not allowed.

title: much hyped best avoidable
review: this is much hyped zoo one regrets after visiting with great difficulty, too many stairs and walk. animals not sighted most of the time and very poorly kept look never fed by zoo authorities .best avoidable both time and money wise.

title: Looks like its more of trekking on plain path rather than zoo.
review: Go here if you have lots of time and you have nothing else to visit .

title: A very big zoo , lots of climbing to visit
review: its such a big zoo but you have to climb upwards 45 degree roads to go to each cage , going with small kids can be difficult.

title: Zoo on the top of the hill
review: its such a big zoo on the top of the hill. well managed by the government you canfind all the animals birds here. the most attractive is Bengali tiger.

title: Zoo at the top, thats interesting!!
review: One can easily say that what extraordinary there, it's just another zoo, but as the name suggests, you are gonna experience a large variety of animals at high altitude, that makes it interesting.

title: Mr
review: Beautiful place with some interesting high altitude animals....

title: Zoo with making difference at high Altitude
review: Nainital Zoo is a part of forest department venture, Government maintain and conserve wild life over here. Any one can visit this at 8am to 5pm. with a token to enter here.

title: Wow place
review: Very well maintained zoo we had a glimpse of tiger tigress leopard deers and so many others.Animals and  birds also seem to enjoy there we saw a peacock dancing must go place

title: Well maintained must visit place
review: This is one of the kind high altitude zoo  and is very well maintained..

title: Awesome place
review: This is a must to visit place in Nainital, very well maintained ,unique kind of zoo.

title: Nice Zoo
review: The high altitude zoo at Nainital is a small zoo. Shuttle taxi service is available at Mall road to reach there. The zoo has tigers, leopards, black beer, deers and so many birds. Very pleasant atmosphere at high altitude. Food items are strictly prohibited inside.

title: Good for kids
review: Good for kids but lot of travel hassel esp during vacation season.

title: Small Zoo
review: A small zoo situated on the top of a hill, it was raining when we visited the place, this is a small zoo which limited numbers

title: Best zoo ever..
review: Thanks to the altitude, amazing views and steep walkways the experience is lot more than being in a zoo, also comes with a free pick up and drop facility from the mall road. If you are young enough to take a trek go for it!

title: Super zoo.
review: It's a zoo about 700 feet higher than the Nainital lake and affords super views of Nainital.

title: Pocket size dynamite would be the phrase to define this zoo.
review: This zoo is located in the heart of the main city.

title: Family trip
review: Since there was nothing apart from the Lake in Nainital, we made the mistake of going to the Zoo. First the approach - if you walk, it is a steep uphill and inside the zoo also you have to climb to see the animals. So go if you have the requisite stamina as it is very tiring

title: Outings
review: We visited to see the collection of rare animals and birds.

title: Better than Expected
review: We visited the Zoo much to the delight of our kid. Having been to some Zoo's both in India and Asia, we weren't sure how good this Zoo will be.

title: Nice
review: Nice but they should increase the time otherwise people could notsee all things they should improve it and add some more antic animls

title: Good to visit for Kids and family
review: Except the climb , it's a worth visiting place. You will have to take a shuttle from near India hotels mall road. Private vehicles are not allowed - would suggest you to not take your own vehicle considering the narrow road. The Zoo is open from 10:30 to 4:30 and closed on Monday.

title: Totally Go there if u have kids with you
review: A zoo at a high altitude is totally a great experience specially with rain playing hide and seek. Go there even if its raining as there are lots of benches with shades there. Enjoy the waether and see animals in the hills. Kids loved it ..A good fun experience

title: Kids time
review: We have visited Nainital Zoo as we had heard lot and also to entertain our children. The main attraction was Tiger also we have seen Panther, Bear, Deer and other animals but Tiger with that size is amazing to watch. Nice visit overall.

title: A must visit place
review: Beautifully made.zoo, kaap.lot of water..Wonderfully irises the available.space. children must visit. Kudos to the municipality who are.runnibg shuttle buses to the zoo with nominal charges. Gr8 going

title: It was gud experience to go through Nainitaal zoo.
review: You can add it in your places to be visited there. It was nice. Main attraction was tiger & Leopard. It will consure your whole day but you will enjoy it. Lake view from Zoo was too good.

title: excellant place
review: excellent place should be visited at least once with family.small children will love it.though the walk is steep.good collection of animals.must go place in nainital.

title: Nice zoo but limited animals compared to other zoo.
review: This zoo is situated around 1.5 km from Nainital mall road. Best part about this zoo is that you can exit from any point if you are tired. You can take the shuttle service from mall road to reach zoo which cost around 30 rupees for both side.

title: Must visit place
review: As the name suggest you have to climb a little to reach this zoo but once you reach here you can watch wild animals and birds. Especially 2 tigers.bear,leopard,monkeys etc. Zoo is well maintained. Entrance of zoo is very attractive. You can easily spend a couple of hours here.

title: Unique of its kind
review: It is a zoo like any other...but what is different here is the location and view!! .. as name suggest it is at top and you can see entire naintal from top... calm and pleasant climate

title: Nainital
review: Zoo is best... Very high location but kids enjoy... must see...

title: A really different Zoo!!
review: beautiful and a must visit zoo, one of its kind hill zoo. Though animals should always be in their natural habitat, and zoo certainty is a contrasting place , nainital zoo administration tried their best to provide a much better environment to its animal residents. Zoo is nicely marked and one can traverse complete zoo within 50 minutes

title: Really high altitude Zoo
review: To cover all the animals on display in this Zoo you must be prepared to walk very long, ascend/descend landscape. Every animal is in very good shape. You need to get ride from Mall road till some distance away from Zoo.

title: Good place to see different animals
review: It is a good zoo to visit.one can see different different types of animals there like tiger , lion , leopard , bear , panda , deer , owl , different types of birds.

title: A Niche Zoo of India
review: A well planned and maintained Zoo. It has very rare animal of High Altitude such as Blue Sheep, Markhor, Red Panda, Tibetan Wolf ect. Even the enclosures of its carnivorous animals are kept extremely clean with a touch of that species’ natural habitat. Even its Hilly Bird collection is also well thought off. The concerned DFO and its staff is always attentive for the maintenance. One can avail city us service to reach this zoo. One word of caution, full zoo is laid on the ridge of a mountain slope with lot of paved up-down paths, it is better that aged people and persons with high Blood Pressure should avoid or take extra care to visit this zoo. It has a souvenir shop and privately run cafeteria. The full path between different enclosures’ are well laid off with place for rest and drinking water at regular interval.

title: Good view from the top. Requires lot of uphill walk
review: There is a shuttle service available from the mall road for a nominal charge of rs 40 per person..be ready for waiting during season time. However be alert as the numbers keep changing dramatically. Like our waiting was 153 but as we went near the shuttle service provider we just got through quickly. Be prepared for a long uphill walk. We saw the tiger from near. Was a good experiece. View from top was good

title: Amazing place, never saw such healthy animals in my life! Must visit.
review: One must visit this zoo if you are in nainital. Its nearby mall road.

title: Fun for children
review: Shuttel service@₹40/person available,still150metre steep walk.charges₹ 50/adult &₹20/child.has steep climb during visit.although just like any other zoo,but if you have spare time of 2-3hrsthen UST visit asview of city from uphill is mind-blowing.children will surely enjoy.has a restaurant at entry.not suitable for oldpersons who have difficulty in walking or asthma.It has animals like tigers leopard red panda,bear and some lovely birds

title: Animals Look Well-Cared For
review: Great experience - had to walk a lot - very steep climb, so if you are not up to walking, skip this. We took the kids here - they are toddlers - and they loved it.

title: Big and well kept
review: Be prepared to walk a lot that too uphill but on gentle slopes. Very well kept. We couldn't see all of it. Not physically fit enough. Good collection.

title: Must visit!!
review: This is one of the best zoo's in India. It serves as a good trek and the place is beautiful to walk. Well developed and maintained, you can find wide variety of birds and animals here living in the jungle like build. Do make time to visit this place if you are in Nainital.

title: well maintained...
review: this high altitude zoo in nainital is very well maintained...clean and neat...have to walk some distance up the hills...could see tiger, leopard, bear, sambar deer,etc...

title: Animal Watching cum trekking
review: This is surely not meant for people with weak knees. All of the walk in the zoo is steep slope. The zoo is well maintained and has some interesting birds and animals. The white peacock and some of the colorful parrots are to look out for. Also, the tibetan wolf, red panda are a rare sight and not something we find in alot of zoos in India.

title: A lot of walk
review: I would straight away say that this zoo makes you do a lot of walking but all the animals are worth the effort. There is a steep slope that one has to take before entering the zoo which makes one tired but the management is very thoughtful and have made plenty of places where one can sit and take rest. My parents are in the late 50s and overweight and unfit but they could finish the zoo in 2 hrs, they were tired at the end but they liked it. There's a place on the. Mall Road just before the entry road of the zoo where one has to take a 2 way pass of Rs 40 for pick up and drop. Pvt. Cars and taxis are not allowed till the zoo as the road is very narrow and there's a lot of traffic. It is compulsory If you want to visit the zoo. Also we visited during peak season and so had a lot of rush when we reached at around 9.30 am, so be early viz before 9 am so that you would have to wait for less time before your turn for the pick up.

title: Nice zoo
review: This is situated on a mountain and trust me a very good zoo with a lot of different kind of animals like bengal tiger, panthers, panda, deer and a lot of birds. Whenever in nainital, one muat go to this place and also it is a bit far from mall road so good if you hire car service.

title: A must see spot from Nainital
review: Firstly, how to reach here from Nainital center. Ask anyone for the market place, there is shop from where you can buy a ticket for to and fro ride in very cheap rate. Avoid reaching hotel reception for reserve a car. It is near and you can even walk to get there.

title: Weekend break
review: It's hot in Nainital.. but the property is on an altitude so was pleasant their.. Nainital has nothing and is so commercialised

title: Best Zoo!!
review: Animals look healthy and a very well designed zoo, It has Tiger , Leopard , Red Panda etc The layout of animal cages is good .

title: A different experience
review: One should visit it if one is in Nainital. It is a different experience as zoo is on hills. One has to climb up and come down. Types of animals are as in any other zoo but those are healthy. It may be due to good weather.

title: Adventurous place but lot of walking on high slopes
review: The zoo is one of the best with its collection and place is beautiful with flora & fauna. The animals and birds are nicely managed and displayed. Our children enjoyed a lot despite too much climbing on slopes.

title: A MUST VISIT ZOO.
review: You should must visit this place for your children. The zoo contains mostly many animals and birds. just is that we have to walk very very much. and to visit the zoo we cannot come in our car. they provide the car which is chargeable.from down .

title: Good Zoo at hill top
review: It is a wonderful neatly maintained Zoo. The only disadvantage is it is at peak where you need to walk up the hill a bit and the closes by 4.30 pm. So the best time to visit this Zoo is anywhere between 10 am to 2.00 pm. If you are late than 2.00 pm better not to go. We had to rush to just reach at 4.30 pm and we were sent out with in 30 minutes as the Zoo closes at 5.00 pm.

title: Difficult to reach
review: It is not easy to reach there at the zoo. After getting down from the zoo shuttle service, you have to walk a km or so.  And that too straight inclined walk. But here zoo shop is very great.... You can purchase many gift items which are of this zoo only.

title: Different than other zoos!
review: There is a zoo shuttle which charges 40INR to take you to the zoo. after you get down, an uphill walk of 100m takes you to the ticket counter. 50INR is the ticket for an adult. The unique thing about the zoo is the well maintained landscape, and the cleanliness around it. Animals of all kinds were there. Tigers, leopards, bears, birds etc !!

title: Great zoo
review: This was a pleasant surprise... Its on a hill... The animals seen are much better than the ones seen in Mumbai... They have beat leopards tigers and different animals with watching....

title: Lots of walking on steep slopes
review: Visit only if you have lots of free time, stamina to walk on the steep slopes.  Not recommended for the elderly.  Reaching the entrance of the zoo is not all..once you enter....each enclosure is on a different slope.  Once you are done, it feels like you trekked up and down the hill.  A good collection of birds and animals.  Ghoral, the blue sheep was a first time for me.  The summer heat was surely affecting the animals.

title: Zoo at an altitude
review: It is probably one of the Zoos located at a very high altitude. nainital is located very near famour Corbett national park and if you are not able to find the Lion or a Tiger there, you can visit the Zoo to find them for sure. It hosts a number of endangered speciies in a well maintained environment.

title: Zoo was good but one have to climb mountain which is very tiring.
review: Zoo was good but one have to climb mountain which is very  tiring and you end up cursing yourself that why you were there. Moreover to reach zoo one have to wait for hours to get the shuttle service which is not at all worth it.

title: Great place to visit
review: It is a high altitude zoo. It has to accessed by zoo taxi. You have to walk up the hill. Lot of high gradient slope. You have to climb stairs to view the animals. It is worth the effort. The animals very close to view. There are two tigers which are very close to view. Good exhibit of animal and a very clean zoo. Good view of Nainital lake from the zoo. Clear markings on the road for going around the zoo. You need to have 1h to go around all the exhibits. Lot of resting places are provided for you ease your legs. Don't miss the experience,

title: Just Another Zoo
review: Dear traveler its just another zoo.... and if you have already visited zoo at Delhi, Lucknow and Kanpur... you may get disappointed by spending so much time there.... Yes if you wana to climb great heights....  Choice is yours....

title: Small Zoo
review: A neat and clean Zoo built on a hill, with not too many animals. Walking around takes quite an effort. Kids enjoyed watching the leopards and Bengal tiger and white peacocks in particular.

title: great wildlife
review: its a great place to watch many wild animals. mostly himalayan animals are spotted in this Zoo...must visit

title: Must see to feel like wandering among clouds!!!!!!!
review: The view from the zoo is marvellous. You will see the whole nainital city from there. adding to that, you will have a plenty of fauna in the zoo to attract the travellers. Nice place.

title: perfect environment for the animals!!
review: Beautiful ambience ...only little tough to reach.

title: Good Zoo...nice collection...
review: Its a nice and well maintained zoo. The collection was decent. The zoo was situated on high so please think before going if you looking to go by walk, older peoples or kids might face difficulty so would definitely suggest vehicle for them.

title: Well-Maintained Zoo
review: What I really liked about Nainital Zoo is how well maintained it is. It has a manicured garden area from where the view of the city and its lake is spectacular. I did not get to see the tiger, as he was asleep in his den but leopards and the  white peacock looked quite active. One has to ascend to explore the zoo, so if you are with aging parents or young kinds it is better to avoid this place.

title: Huge varieties of animals
review: This zoo consists of a very wide varieties of animals and it is surely worth visiting. Animals are well-fed and all are healthy

title: Zoo time
review: Zoo with a hike adventure

title: Must visit
review: This zoo is a must visit for animal lovers. I personally dont support caging wild animals but all animals and birds in this zoo were having good health.

title: A good zoo - must visit once
review: It is a well maintained zoo with marked pathway guiding and enabling easy movement from one enclosure to the next. It is built on a hill, and therefore, has very steep climb going up from the entrance gate (and so is easy while coming down). So, do relax in between enclosures while going up (there are shaded benches to sit and catch up with breath).

title: Great zoo
review: Amazing climb to see an exhilarating view and well kept zoo with lots of animals. Must visit with small kids. They​love the views. Not much fun otherwise. U get basic food and drink at the premises.

title: Amazing
review: it was perfect weather to walk around.  you had to really walk a lot to spot the animals.  we enjoyed being here.

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: Getting to the High altitude Xoo in Nainital is an adventure in itself. The shuttle service (sometimes irregular) starts from Mall road, and one can only use these vehicles to get to the zoo entrance. The ride is a bumpy one with a steep ascent through a narrow winding road, almost like a roller coaster ride!

title: Journey is more beautiful than destination
review: First of all, this place is good. There is a good variety of animals available there. But It's not that good. This zoo doesn't even has a lion.

title: Stone's throw from new Bharat hotel
review: Zoo was lot of walk but it's beautifully done lots of flowers though I m not a great supporter of captivity for animals but now that it's there it's a must visit

title: Date with  Tiger at High Altitude
review: High altitude zoo,is situated at higher altitude.Approach to ticket window itself is bit challenging due to its steep gradient.

title: Tiring journey
review: Zoo is at a high altitude... you have to be in queue for a Govt Cab which will take you to zoo and after that a steep slope of 300m, It was very tiring.

title: At a high altitude
review: As the name suggests, the zoo requires above average amounts of walking along steep slopes, but it is very clean and there is quite a few exotic animals like wolves from Siberia, the giant panda, Himalayan snow leopard and Bengal tiger.

title: Worth the trip, but bring your walking shoes
review: We did a lightening trip to this zoo, covering it in under 2 hours (we had another engagement nearby). Overall, it may not quite meet the standard of Western zoos in terms of wildlife-centric spaces, but the enclosures were large and genuinely varied, with a fair amount of stimulation available for the large animals.  Education from the signage is good and we actually knew a lot of what the guides tried to tell us when we went on safari later in the week. Make sure you get all the way to the top, where they have 4 leopard sharing an enclosure who are much more active than the two isolated ones lower down. Also, the red pandas are adorable.

title: Well maintained
review: Very well maintained Zoo. You should definitely visit this if you are in Nainitaal. Lots of animals and bird species in the zoo.

title: Visit it once
review: Situated in heart of the city (near mall road), this place will not disappoint you. The Zoo is on the top of the hill and to go from mall road to Zoo, you have to use shuttle service. Avoid any private vehicles, as they are not allowed and may cause unnecessary disputes. Zoo is very clean and beautiful and have lots of animals like - Tiger, Bear, Panda, Dear, leopards etc etc. Zoo, adopt these animals for 1 year only or less for their good health. So anyone who hate to see the animals in prison can also visit this place. :) Their is also a restaurant at the entrance of gate, although the food is not that good but they provide quite a beautiful sitting location.

title: Clean and well setup
review: Visiting the zoo after nearly half a decade i was disappointed to learn the snow leopards had died off. That didnt dampen my young neices sprites. The bengal tiger and cheethas along wid the large variety of birds clearly facinated her. The walk up the hill starts off cluttered with hotels bt soon u leave all that behind for a nice albeit fairly taxing hill climb

title: Felt pity on encaged King of jungle
review: Good to find all at one place. But felt pity for so many independent but engaged animals and birds. Need strong legs to see all. Good scene of Nainital and it's Tal from here.

title: Zoo
review: Nainital Zoo is located at the top of Nainital. View is excellent. Has got all type of animals except elephant and reptiles

title: Worth visiting no matter how many zoos you have visited
review: Though small in size the zoo packs log of wild animals and birds on varying heights to test your stamina. It takes around 2 hour to visit this place. To enjoy complete zoo follow the yellow mark. The zoo is very clean. A fun for teenagers and young children.

title: zoo....zoo....
review: its same like other city nothing is new except red panda. very high altitude, aged , pregnant,low stamina and disable people please avoid this place.

title: Adventure
review: Not preferring for heart patience. You have to walk and need stamina for it. If you are crazy to see tigers and leopards then its worth to visit at least once.

title: EXCELLENT INFORMATIVE PLACE TO KNOW ABOUT WILDLIFE
review: Excellent place and very well maintained by the forest department of Uttarakhand. Scenic beauty and a very good assembly of wild animals attract wildlife lovers to visit this place.Do please visit this place if you are visiting Nainital

title: Amazing Zoo
review: A must visit if you are in Nanitaal. Clean zoo with healthy Animals. The best part is you can see beautiful Nanitaal from the top of the zoo. Seems like the higest point there.

title: Lovely Place to See.
review: We had been to Nainital Zoo, it was great experience. Animals are so healthy looking, we need to walk a lot, it is situated at various levels., lovely warli paintings. It is a must see for all. lovely flowers around.

title: Good Zoo
review: Had a great experience. The only negative is that this being an High Altitude Zoo you need to walk steep slopes. Be prepared to walk.

title: Very steep
review: The zoo is really at high altitude and there is very steep waking to be done from cage to cage. The animals are nothing extraordinary except for the tiger and bear.

title: Awesome Views
review: Clean and well maintained. Awesome views from zoo. However its very tiring with kids.

title: One of the best zoo in India !
review: The zoo is at high altitude on the hill. Shuttles ply from market to zoo at regular intervals. The zoo is a house for variety of animals from bengal tiger,Siberian wolves,Panda,Snow leopard,and variety of birds. The zoo and the animals are very well maintained. Only draw back for those having problem walking should think twice. Senior citizens can attempt it with breaks in between. Overall a very good experience.

title: Must visit place if you are travelling to Nainital
review: There are shuttle services available from mall road to the zoo. Since the zoo is situated high up in the hills and the road isn't exactly in ship shape, I would recommend you take the shuttle and leave your own car at the hotel.

title: Just Lovely
review: Just lovely, not for the animals but the gorgeous view from top of the hill above Malital in Nainital. A walk up to it is difficult except for the very young but a local taxi will drive you up to it easily.

title: Good for kids
review: We went there by the special shuttles (from the mall road near Alka hotel, I guess), we could not take our own vehicle there, it was not allowed. We did not find anything much interesting there, however, kids enjoyed quite a lot there. For me it was just another normal zoo! But yes I would like to admit one thing that having come back from there I was thinking that It was good that they did not allow any vehicle but the shuttle to the zoo :P !!

title: Vry well maintained zoo
review: Zoo is on vry much top of th city whr you can hv b'ful view of th naini lake. Zoo has tiger, leopard, bear, owl, tibbet wolf, barking deer etc. one can find tiger here which is near to impossible to find in Corbett Reserve. entry ticket is rs 50 for adult but approaching road to zoo is vry narrow. one has to hire a taxi from      mall road. one time visit

title: Tigress steals the show
review: To get there it takes a little trekking for 10 to 15 mins if you want are interested in trekking or else you can hire a cab or if you have your own vehicle you can directly reach the entrance of the zoo. The charges are Rs.50 per adult and 30 for children as you enter into the zoo there are different types of birds and then little bit away from there you can see the tiger which is the main attraction i would say as i have seen lot of people stood almost 30 mins watching the tiger and did i tell you it is actually quite spectacular when it comes close to you and stops infront of you for a second and after that little bit further you can find leopard and himalayan beer which is quite lazy and the you will be greeted by deer and 2 more leopards on top of hill and on way back you find more birds like owl, hawk, eagle, vulture, monkeys, parrots, peacocks, sambar, wolf and Red panda there are 4 to 5 of them which are very cute. I would advise you to spend good 40 to 50 mins in the zoo and you can have a beautiful sunset view from the entrance of the zoo, and yeah the zoo closes by 5pm.

title: Can be improved
review: Very few animals in the zoo. The location is very good and so is the way it is made. i hope they have more species of animals

title: Gr8
review: Gr8 job by wild life department to manage a zoo at such height with good amount of variety of wild animanls

title: Get up to the common leopards!
review: Well managed, clean with step-free access for most places. But you need some stamina to climb up the altitude.

title: well maintained, good
review: one of the best maintained zoo. compact and nice. i loved it. but be prepared to walk a lot >> up and down. hahaha .....

title: Great place.
review: Nainital Zoo, has descriptive boards placed at the entrance of each and every cage.But you need some stamina to climb up the altitude.The guards are friendly in educating the visitors about the residents. Very nice place!!

title: Enjoyably Zoo
review: it's on height some variety of animals hear children are enjoy hear if you travel with child so must see

title: Very clean zoo!!
review: Zoos' have always been something I have loved visiting ever since childhood. As a wild lifer and naturalist, I really do not appreciate animals or birds being caged, however well kept zoo is an eye opener to a lot of people who are really naive about wildlife.

title: Good Place
review: Its a good place for the visit the problem is that you have to physically strong to walk on the slope as it situated on the mountains slopes

title: No animal spotted.
review: After a tedious task of climbing uphill we could see only a tiger, 2 cheetah a bear and an aging deer. Total waste of time and energy. Strongly advised to miss this place.

title: Limited animals very steep walking
review: Tiger looked nice but was in small cage prowling backwards and forwrds constantly. Other animals looked in poor condition and many could not be seen at all. Not expensive entrance fee though

title: zoo on top of hill
review: one of the best zoo of india with wide varieties fauna. we enjoyed full day observing animals.

title: High Mountains and Animals
review: It's Really a High Altitude Zoo, not too big but if you are not so much fit you will feel Tired very Tired, but as you climb high you will start Feeling comfortable, so don't give up in start.

title: Few Animals
review: This zoo is at the top of the hill. A good physical activity is required for this attraction. I was not able to see the tiger because the tiger didn't come outside from its cage. Zoo shuttle is available in the mall road which will take us at this place.

title: Beautifully Managed zoo
review: its a nice zoo at a very high attitude. It is managed very well. very neat and clean but you have to walk  a lot to see entire zoo. its very big. i would suggest only go when you can walk a lot. Otherwise you will feel very tired and will not be able to go anywhere else.

title: Very Well  Maintained! Delight for young kids
review: While it is not a very big zoo, the climb up the hill to see the animals is a unique experience. Tiger and Leopards are the main draw. There are quite a few other animals and birds species belonging to the region. The zoo is very clean and well maintained with clear signage and directions for visitors

title: Nee high enery levels
review: Really high altitude. After a steep taxi drive one has to climb more to reach the Zoo and every enclosure is at a higher level. Zoo is well maintained and worth a visit

title: Well maintained (Highest altitude Zoo)
review: A must visit for every traveler in Nainital. Gear your feet up as this place will keep you walking up the hill to experience the animals. Its  worth the walk and you may not even realize it as the zoo is well worth the walk. The top of the zoo also provides a beautiful view of the town, lake and the hills on the sides. one can get  a drop till the base of the zoo by a jeep ride from the bus stand. they charge per head for the drop and pick up. once at the base a walk of 10 minutes takes you to the entrance of the zoo.

title: High Altitude..
review: Very high Altitude Zoo.. You need very much stamina and time to visit this place.. My personal experience says no one can reach to the top of this zoo..

title: zoo
review: good maintain zoo ....all animal were healty and good ....its little up so older people may get difficulties to walk becoz no other facility is avilabel....

title: Zoo of nainital
review: Its on the top of the hill small zoo, all animals are there, whole nainital view can be seen Clouds are generally seen down above naini lake, in rainy season mostly their is rain like every half an hour its raining, some people didn't like that but i love it. Enjoyed allot

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Zoo is located top of the Nainital city ... they have Tiger , Leopards , Bear , Deer , Monkeys & some of rare Birds ...

title: One of the extremely well maintained and clean Zoos
review: You must visit this zoo if you are in Nainital. There's some ascent walking that is required. But its worth the effort. The zoo is extremely clean and well maintained and you can view the animals and birds easily.

title: Zoo is best but on hill
review: For the senior citizens this place some about hectic coz to much walking is required on hill to see the beautiful animals n birds species, scenic view of city from the zoo, you definitely like this with childrens,

title: Great place for kids.....big and small
review: Beautifully maintained animals. It is a must visit place in Nainital, if you have kid. Or even otherwise. Especially the tiger is magnificent !!

title: Zoo at Sher Ka Danda Hills
review: The high altitude zoo is covered with beautiful flora,which includes some rare flowering and ornamental plants.It is a home to a wide variety of wildlife species which includes the siberian tigers,snow leopard,black beers and tibetan wolf.

title: Small but good
review: Compared to the other zoos i hsve been to this place has very few animals and is very small.

title: Zoo at such height
review: It was a wonderful experience at this zoo. View is awesome from here. It took 3 to 4 hours to look for all animals. More fun if you go with children. All types of birds mammals and different species.

title: The best Zoo
review: This Zoo is even better than Delhi zoo in terms of cleanliness and animal-density. The animals can be easily spotted in the enclosures. only problem is too much walking

title: Well fed animals :)
review: The zoo is well laid out. The number of animals are not high, but quality is. One thing that many other visitors were also talking was that how well fed animals look. The royal bangal tiger really looked royal. Their are many leopards. Kids enjoyed visiting zoo. There is steep climb to reach the gate of zoo and there are steep Climbs inside too.

title: Must even if you have no children with you,healthy animals
