review: Beautiful.many sign boards in Nainital give opening hour as 9 am.actually it is 10am.there should be a electric/ petrol small open 2 seater car- on payment-because it is very steep.one of 2 bungalows near gate should be knocked off for car parking

title: Zoo cum trek
review: True to its name ....it is quite high up. But easily accessible as there is a cheap shuttle service which will take you up right to the zoo gate. But once in also, in order to see the various enclosures you will need to climb up & down stairs several times. But it's all worth it..there is a moderate variety of animals & birds and the decor is quite impressive too. A canteen is also there too

title: High altitude zoo is for Young and healthy
review: This October we revisited nainital for the third time. We stayed for three days and two nights .one fine morning we visited the high altitude zoo (Pandit Ballav panth).

title: Zoo On Top A Mountain
review: The only high altitude Zoo located atop a mountain 6900 FT above Sea Level. Very huge one needs to walk a lot in order to explore it. Bengal Tigers and leopards can be easily spotted

title: Where animals stand tall with the moutains
review: This is one of the most beautiful zoos in India, which is perched on a hill and reaches all the way to the top. The highlight of the zoo is that it is a small trek where you can glimpse the animals in their closed enclosures. The way up is fantastic with neatly laid pavements and stone benches at every attraction. I enjoy visiting this zoo whenever I visit Nainital. Again, it is a must try attraction in Nainital.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: One has to go by Jeep or a taxi operated by the city to go to Zoo. Even after reaching the dropping point one has to walk steep road to reach the zoo. This may be tiresome for old people and small kids.

title: Zoo @ Nainital
review: A lot of Uttarakhand Himalayan animals and birds. Tiger, 3 leopards, few Tibetan wolves, various types of Deer especially those found in higher altitudes, Black bears and various Hawks, pheasants, peacocks, peahens. Worth a visit can spend about a day at this place. Try to return before sunset though as the shuttle service back to Mall Road can get crowded. Entry takes longer than usual.

title: Worth a visit.
review: One of the most enchanting zoo I've ever seen. Sadly it use to have a siberian tiger who has died. Wonderful collection of birds. Red panda couple most adorable

title: Nice tracking experience 👣👣👣💪💪
review: Park situated at the top of hill from where you can see the naintal lake and town easily. Nice location.

title: Awesome small zoo
review: Unlike other zoos of the country this one is very small in size. Reduced size means you can cover the entire zoo in a couple of hours.

title: Great place to visit with kids
review: Be prepare to do a lot of hill walking if you want to see every corner. But its a great place to visit with kids to see their favorite animals and enjoy a good view.

title: Lots of Climbing but Worth it
review: This high altitude zoo is unlike any zoo you have seen. It houses animals like red panda and himalayan bear. There is no walking in this zoo; the paths are steep and exploring the zoo is tiring.

title: Worth Exploring!
review: It's good to spend time with family while exploring zoo and the only pain point is the height that you will have to walk. Rest the animal range and scenic views are worth giving it a try!

title: Average
review: Have to walk long not advised for kids as they get tired so it can be avoided only 10 to 12 animals r there

title: High altitude zoo//beautifull view of nainital
review: Lot of animals and birds are here special attraction is Siberian tiger. A high altitude zoo so as it mentioned you need to walk to reach here from the parking point which is approx 200m distance from zoo starting gate.

title: A Must Visit if you have time
review: Beautifully laid out with large number of animals! The tigers in this zoo are well-fed and look wonderful. Take a walk to the top and get a view of the snow peaks on a clear day.

title: Nice
review: I did not even know there was a zoo in Nainital, even after multiple trips. Thanks to a dear friend who asked me to check this out, we got to know about it and what a fun place it was. Must visit.

title: High Altitude Zoo
review: Probably it's Highest Altitude Zoo in India . Located on beautiful place but displays mostly small animals and birds. One Tiger , Two leopards and two Tibetan Wolf are the big USP. Good collection of birds and small animals.

title: Better than others
review: The shuttle service was nice and fast . You need not wait for a car to take you . The bad point is that you have to walk a little . You can have a nice and if lucky then clear view of nainital . The zoo experience was good . Nice decorations . It also has places to rest  at the middle .  Good collection of animals .

title: Good well maintained zoo at high altitude
review: Nainital – High Altitude Zoo

title: Informative zoo
review: I am not a big fan of zoo since animals and birds are kept in the cage but since there were 3 kids travelling with us; we thought it would be great if they could see different species of birds or animals..

title: Zoo on Mountain
review: Nice zoo with different Animals and flowers. Seating arrangements are quite good. All facility available in the zoo

title: If you visit this Zoo, you can shell out some fat. Too much physical exercise!
review: Animals are taken care well and are healthy. Being a high altitude Zoo, the type of animals are limited. For reaching, you can have a Zoo shuttle starting just before mall road begins. Too steep.. If you find difficulty to climb (after getting down from shuttle). Take rest and climb. Will require about 2-3 Hrs.

title: Average Zoo
review: Only thing unique about this zoo is its location. ..its not an easy trip for senior citizens probably thats why its free for them....avoid if u have a small baby..its quite difficult to carry small kid all around...zoo is however is clean and well maintained. ...a spot which  cud be skipped

title: Nice place for young kids
review: Good zoo with limited animals but clean. White peacock is a must. It is uphill so difficult for elderly and small kids to walk so much.

title: Very Good experience inside the Zoo
review: The zoo is really good. The kids loved it.

title: Good
review: Very nice, in month of February we plan to visit nainital .so please inform to me for local visit tour and travel.

title: Must visit
review: There are usually many zoos which do not have variety of animals. But this zoo is not one of them. We saw tiger, leopard, white peacock, panda etc. It was a great visit!

title: Visited earlier...
review: Didn't visit this time because the famous Siberian Tiger and the Snow Leopard is no more, however if you haven't been there even once, it is a must visit. There are shuttle services available from the mall road @ INR 30/- per head to and fro 10 am to 4 pm (Monday Closed), the ticket is INR 50 for adults.

title: Small zoo - you will be healthy
review: It was in very high altitude . From mall road we have to take zoo shuttle service who charge 40₹ pp up and down. I hope that's the only easy way to reach there. Else you have to walk . I recommend not to walk because you have to elk a lot more in zoo . It will be hiking in zoo. Even this shuttle will not go till the gate of the zoo. They wil drop in a point and you have to walk. But that it the only way . No car parking. Zoo have very limited animals. But it will be good learning for kids. And the walk to zoo and inside zoo will make you healthy.

title: Clean and Small but on high altitude
review: Location is good, naini lake looks beautiful surrounded by hills. I visited it on 23rd June, 2016 after checking out the hotel situated at the Zoo Road only and decided to go on foot which became pain for elder in our family. It is really situated at high altitude and you will find many animal and birds over there.

title: Nainital zoo
review: I am not in favour of zoo and totally against the concept of caged animals I visited the place as part of my project work the zoo is well kept & clean though I felt the enclosure for tiger should be spread out but otherwise a must visit for families with small children

title: A steep climb but worth it
review: The zoo was one of the main highlights for my young son, who loves animals. The zoo is a bit of a climb, as the roads are a winding one. But the animals were healthy, and we managed to see exotic animals, such as white tiger up close. A must see - especially for kids.

title: Awesome
review: Although we went to Zoo by walking. It's on high altitude and we have to walk and then climb 200 stairs. Ticket cost was 50INR. They have shuttle service which cost 40INR. However awesome experience. You can see Tiger, Leopard etc.

title: A must watch
review: During our trip to Nainital, the first spot visited by us was Nainital Zoo. With excellent infrastructure & proper maintenance the place is a must watch for everyone. The animals in the Zoo were very healthy and beautiful. Enjoyed the place very much.

title: Zoo at Nainital⛳
review: Nainital zoo is one of the best high altitudes place in Uttarakhand.Very near to mall road and towards tallital .I remember Zoo shuttle charged @ ₹40 per person for pick and drop.It took 2-4 minutes to reach Zoo where again u pay for entrance of ₹50 per person.But place is amazing carry umbrella is must in rainy season like sep .Family members enjoying whether and new add up Animals in Zoo.Animals kept in good condition and can be easily identifiable.Overall a good experience .

title: Well maintained zoo, had fun
review: The zoo was approachable by zoo shuttle from various pick and drop points from the mall road.Very reasonable priced tickets for the Shuttle and zoo entry.Well maintained Zoo.Kids will have lots of fun.

title: Excellent zoo @ Nainital
review: The high altitude zoo @ Nainital is excellent. The location is also good which provides a

title: Well maintained zoo, had fun”
review: Zoo was altogether different...with a good architecture and made between hills. Altogether different and good place along with lakes.

title: Nanitaal zoo
review: I should say ...IF U HAVE CAPACITY TO TRAVEL or to climb or i can say to track this place is awsome fo u guys!!

title: A place you can call Marvel
review: What a place! At that height with such vigorous, you find some of the finest green pastures and animals. Siberian Tiger was the major attraction but the owls, birds, flora and fauna at this beautiful sight seeing point is worth your time. What might amaze you is the upkeep of the place and the difficulty of maintaining it. But they did a fine job.

title: Good and bad
review: Leopards were in an extremely small cage, i felt very uncomfortable watching them. The deer on the other hand had a big enclosure. Also some group of guys followed me around and wanted to take pictures with me as a foreigner.

title: corbett tiger over there.
review: i saw corbett tiger in high altitude zoo nainital, it was nice to see tiger. whenever you go nainital please visit to nainital zoo.

title: Nice getaway with kids and family
review: This is claimed to be one of the highest altitude zoological garden in India. It houses some of the Himalayan fauna which otherwise is not found in the plains of India. A few such inhabitants of the zoo are the Himalayan Red Pandas, the Blue Sheeps, various peafowls, bears and so on.

title: Great Experience for my daughter...
review: I have visited many zoos in India but this is one of the most beautifully located zoo in India. The sections of birds with more than 100 varieties was very exciting. This zoo is easily approachable in Nainital and is a must for every traveller.

title: Poorly maintained
review: Apart from negatives the zoo does not have only one positive-  seeing a red panda

title: childrens likes so much this place
review: this is the modern zoo and you will see here many more anomals and peoples care about the animals and give protection to visitors.

title: Not maintained well....
review: It's not maintained... One can avoid the visit.. No animals. Need to climb a lot to see the cages without animals.

title: Good Place
review: this is good place for children.Its a zoo only adventure loving will admire. You can't take your own vehicle, you have to take a shared taxi (reasonable govt fixed rates). But even the taxi is not allowed to the zoo entrance. You have to walk a lot and climb the hill to reach the entrance. Again climb the hill to see the animals.

title: Nanital Zoo
review: Nanital has high altitude zoo with scenic beauty. It is named after Bharat Ratan Pandit  GovindBallabh Pant.

title: Visit to Nainital Zoo
review: Amazing place to visit especially with kids..  it was raining and  it adds to  refreshing  greenery all around. Very neat n clean place nicely managed. Best of All was  Bangalore Tiger Roaring all around and couple of leopards playing with each other. Bear was hiding under concrete roof to protect from rain... One must visit.

title: Its good if u have children
review: Zoo is on d top of d hill. It take good walk to reach there. Kids will enjoy the zoo otherwise for adults its just ok.

title: Summer trip
review: This is a nice place for zoo lovers situated at high altitude,,no doubt about it all zoo lovers will love it..

title: Weather is Great
review: Zoo is located at the top of Nainital so the weather is awesome and cloudy, you can touch the clouds. There are few animals you can watch, many species of birds are worth watching.

title: Must visit
review: High altitude zoo is must visit during your stay in Nainital. You can get the taxi from outside Church on Mall Road. Zoo is well managed and very clean.

title: Not much of Zoo person! Worth a visit...
review: It was march when we visited Nainital during Holi vacations... It was very crowdy in there. Even the way to reach zoo was totally jam. We waited for couple of hours at mall road and situation got worst. We then decided to go by foot. Zoo was refreshing but animals were all lazying around. Spotted Tiger who was almost hiding at the corner and didnt want to move even after an hour. Few different species of birds were there and so were few restless monkeys. Overall found animals were well kept and were in healthy state. One time visit tou banta hai.

title: Must visit with kids.
review: Best place in Nainital with family and kids. It is on mountain so you need to walk a little bit. But manageable.

title: kids loved it
review: It was my second visit in 5 years with family to this place. The face work and beautification done is good but the sad part is that Siberian tiger is no more! He was the gem on the crown of this zoo.The number of leopards and other wild animals has also come down. Over all good and well maintained place. Kids will love it.

title: tiring but worth it
review: Its a zoo on the hill, the climb does tire you but you get to see good variety of animals. I loved the Tiger in the zoo..as it was the only tiger we could see after 3 safaris in the Jim corbette park

title: Must visit
review: Loved the zoo...the best we have visited till date. Healthy animals. And a must recommend for everyone travelling to Nainital.

title: Perfect for the younger ones
review: Clean, well-maintained with interesting animals and birds, including a tiger and a leopard. It could be a little tiring as there's some climbing involved but great fun. A must-visit place if you are travelling with the little ones.

title: Nice place to visit if you can walk at slant road at mountains.
review: The zoo at these mountain areas are always nice.this one was also good as the in Simla.

title: tiger watch
review: Very interesting place -  zoo as i love wild life .

title: Good architecture and a different kind of Zoo
review: Zoo was altogether different...with a good architecture and made between hills. Altogether different and good place along with lakes. Had a great time but can be imrpoved by adding more animals.

title: Top of mountain, but yes, they do have Red Panda !!
review: Its a zoo only adventure loving will admire. You can't take your own vehicle, you have to take a shared taxi (reasonable govt fixed rates). But even the taxi is not allowed to the zoo entrance. You have to walk a lot and climb the hill to reach the entrance. Again climb the hill to see the animals. Very difficult for kids and  seniors (grand parents). The only good attraction is the Red Panda.

title: activity for kids
review: nice place to visit with kids,but need lots of stamin to reach at different hills bcuse, different animals  caves  are at different places .took one hour to enjoy watching lion and other animals with ur kids

title: Nice Place
review: Its really a altitude Zoo. Height is attractions of Zoo and of course Tiger. Neat and cleanliness is admirable.

title: Children will love it
review: It's a excellent place for children my daughter loved it throughly

title: Lovely Place
review: It is on hight Zoo but I did not find any lepord or tigre in it. but any way it is very good place to see the beauty of nainital.

title: A zoo at the highest point in India.
review: Well, you have to appreciate the efforts of our government who is maintaining the zoo at that height on a hill station. Just a couple of kilometers from mall road in Nainital. You can find tigers, leopards, wolves, bears, monkey as well as lot many beautiful birds. Lot of trees inside the zoo will give you an impression that you are walking in a jungle at places. I wont say that this is a very big zoo compared to what we have seen at other locales. But one will appreciate its incredibility considering its location. You wont find an empty cage up there. The view from the top of the zoo is also breathtaking. You can buy snacks at the ticket counter. Also sitting arrangements are made through out the zoo in case you feel exhausted cause of the uphill movement. You must visit this place if you are in nainital.

title: very bad experience
review: very few birds & animals. no enjoyment. only 1 tiger, 2 leopard and 2 bear. this trip make me and my son too tired.

title: Nanital visit with family
review: I have visit the place with my family members and all are enjoyed.The weather is excellent and we should visit when plan to visit nanital

title: Zoo with a difference
review: Zoo is a special attraction in nainital but it's on a height and a very steep one. You have to be have a lot of stamina particularly if traveling with kids as its very very steep and exhausting.

title: Amazing view and excellent place.
review: The area is not very big but very beautiful because of the peaks and thick forest. Excellent place for kids to see the wild animal. not may animals are there but enough for you to go there and spend some time. you need to buy entry ticket to enter the zoo. Facilities are good inside the zoo, you will get good pure water and food items at the gate. Many beautiful birds and other animals to see.

title: Nanital zoo
review: 1) Shuttle service to the zoo is most irritating for tourist. No proper place for shuttle tickets. Once you get the ticket you really need to fight for the shuttle with other tourists, no proper system.

title: very nicely maintained zoo!!
review: there is a zoo shuttle service started now from the mall road that takes you to the zoo.If you are coming from naina devi side then do take a rickshaw on mall road or walk and you will reach this point from where shuttle starts.Overall it's a good place for kids.

title: Must visit
review: If you are little bit interested in Wildlife u should go. Your family n kids will definitely enjoy not a big zoo but we'll maintained

title: Typical zoo but on a peak
review: The zoo is as usual. Only interesting part is that its on a peak. So a lot of climbing up and down. Good for Kids who enjoy animals.

title: Zoo Gardens
review: Nainital has a small but a vry beatiful Zoological garden.The hygiene and cleaness of the zoo is a point which attracts the mind even if one ignores it.

title: A well maintained zoo
review: Though the animals are not much here, but the zoo is a must visit because of its location and views from the top. But its not for the weak, lazy or people with walking problems. It's at a very steep accent and the walk till there is indeed very tiring. There are no personal vehicles allowed,only govt operated shuttle service . But kids liked the zoo and the red panda , the owl, the pheasants birds and the white peacock..there are also places to eat and drink and relax. I recommend it to all the tourists, especially with young kids

title: scenic beauty
review: a must visit for the scenic beauty.you can have great views of taal from here.

title: A zoo is a zoo but it is at high altitude
review: The height of the zoo with boldly written "zoo" in Hollywood style though looked attractive but was scary because of the height. But moon travels there provide shuttle service at Rs 30 to and fro the zoo which makes it quite a simple trip.not many animals visible in the afternoon  but very pleasant walk and greenery all around. Must visit for kids .

title: Zoo at the Top
review: I have visited many zoo earlier but the best part of this zoo is its location. It's located at the top of the mountain and provides a good view of Nainital and its lake from the top. The zoo was well maintained and had most of the animals in their enclosure. We could see Tiger, Leopard, Bear, Red Panda and some exotic colorful birds. I would recommended a visit to the zoo if you are visiting Nainital.

title: Well maintained zoo
review: The nainital zoo was a big surprise - a very well managed zoo with good enclosures for animals, clean and well marked areas. The downside was the shuttle experience from the Mall to the zoo which was badly managed. The other disappointment was that many enclosures did not hv any animals! It's a steep climb from one enclosure to another, do be prepared for a tiring trek!

title: A worth visiting place
review: The high altitude zoo is a good well maintained zoo with quite a variety of animals. Children will love it and you can see tigers, leopards, bear, pandas, wolves, deers, sambars and variety of birds esp pheAsants.

title: A nice experience
review: The zoo is not very large but situated at a high altitude.  The most memorable experience was watching the tiger, leopards and the red  pandas.

title: Not bad for nainital
review: Personally speaking nainital didn't work for me coz it was way too crowded with riffraff crowds not upto my calling .

title: Good but not important attraction
review: The place is good if you are with children but still not so important as its on height. I still would like to visit Lake, Mall road and Caves and may suggest to skip ZOO

title: High altitude zoo
review: Very nice experience at this zoo.Goog to see animals at this beautiful place on high altitude.something different from other zoo.

title: Avoid at any cost
review: Too many tourists in summer season so you need to wait for 1 hr just to get the shuttle.

title: Small zoo not many animals
review: Going by the reviews about the Nainital zoo we felt it would be one of the best attractions in Nainital. However the number of animals in the zoo was quite disappointing and having seen much larger zoos in Hyderabad and in Mysore we were quite disappointed with the zoo experience.

title: Very nice Zoo
review: Though the zoo is on a height, but still it is a very good experience to visit it. It's good for diabetic paitents.

title: Very good
review: The high altitude zoo is excellent place to visit. Animal and bird kept in the zoo are endangered species. Although it's located in quite high altitude but to worth visit

title: Lot of climbing
review: Not worth physical exercise u have to do ro climb upto there.road is very steep and narrow.only staunch animal lovers may visit

title: Planning to visit Zoo?
review: I planned to visit zoo but due to hepty rush didn't reached there.

title: High Altitude Zoo
review: The trip to the top seemed more like a trek. Everything was so haphazard, right from booking the tickets for the shuttle to take you to the place to the walk up the steep slope. The trip would be worth its while had we seen some animals. But neither was the tiger anywhere to be seen nor the leopard and bear. All we saw were the pheasants. An utter waste of time, money and energy.

title: Nice place to spend some time
review: This is nice place to spend some time in Nainital. Since, place is at height, you have to be ready to walk steep areas. Although, it is not big zoo and you cannot compare with other better zoos of India, I think, it is small, nice and well maintained. You cannot take your car so you have to take shared taxi service from Mall road.

title: Nightmare
review: Saw absolutely nothing as animals were hardly seen in their cages, plus it was really a hike without any outcome ,no animals, reaching the place was a big effort plus only one canteen which was overcrowded even water was not provided in the zoo. If you r willing to climb just for good surrounding view, garden etc but not animals then it's ok. Coz u can see a lot of endangered species named over there but hardly get a glance of them.

title: One of the best High altitude zoo
review: One of the best high altitude zoo I have visited in India. I will put it next to the Darjeeling zoo. There are shared cars available from the Mall road to reach the zoo. Avoid taking your own car as the road is narrow, there is no parking available easily, and they charge fees even if you take your car, based on number of heads. So better to use their shuttle service, which clearly denoted on the road

title: Best Zoo
review: Nainital Zoo is among the very well maintained Zoos in India. It is situated in the hills of Sher ka Danda at about 1 km. from Tallital Bus Station at an elevation of 2100 meters above sea level and connected by motorable road.

title: tigers & beers wow
review: for adventure & thrill lovers this place is amazing, some of u must have gone to jim corbett ti see animals but must have disappointed, to be honest this zoo has  times more animals than jim corbett. you will love it

title: Good place to visit with your children
review: Good place to visit with your children will enjoy great job by the nainital zoo department were neat and clean premises

title: Must Go....!!!
review: Nice zoo ever i have seen,it not a zoo i can say its a spot also where i enjoyed to see the lake and animals which i have never seen before,the best attraction of the zoo was Red Panda, Beer family,Man eater Tigers, Himalayan griffon who was very friendly to us,and state bird Monal and many varieties of Himalayan birds and monkeys.

title: Not good
review: Not at all good.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Nainital zoo is very famous for its white tiger visit from delhi. Although we find many interesting animals there throughout the year.

title: Beautiful Attraction in Nainital
review: The High Altitude Zoo at Nainital is literally a high 2 km trek along a mountain side! During summers can get very warm and one should carry a bottle of water. The trek up can become long and painful.

title: Nice Zoo
review: The location of the zoo is slightly on the higher side but its very neat and clean. Well maintained zoo.

title: the higest zoo
review: good place to visit , pleanty of different birds ,& animals needs alot of climbing up & down , well maintained ,clean

title: Amazing
review: An amazing collection of high altitude animals. Very well maintained and displayed a place worth visiting. Please plan to reach before 4 PM as entry closes at 4:30 PM

title: Good place
review: Main attraction for me was you get a top view of nainital. Animals are few and you may get better Zoos in other parts but what was unique was the location.

title: One of the best zoos in India
review: You have to take a ride from Moon Travels close to Nainital Mall Road to reach this place. The zoo has a naturally green habitat for animals. The unique feature is that there are attractions at different heights. So be prepared to climb slopes on foot a lot. The Bengal tiger in this zoo is one of the best in India. Cheetahs, deer, birds, bears also are good.

title: Must visit if in Nainital
review: Ready to walk n walk if want to see wild animal. Be patience to see animals don't shout else they will hide

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Located at the highest point in Tallitaal, this is the only high altitude zoo in india. here there are several varities of himalayan birds including pheasants, kites, eagles, warblers, peacocks, Hornbills etc

title: Good to go if you have decided to stay in Nainital for long duration.
review: As it is on the mountain so need to climb a lot.

title: nicely maintain
review: Zoo is very good.nicely maintained.but at very high level.if elders are there,avoid going there.pick up & drop services are provided by Zoo management at Rs.30/- per person.you can not take your own car.

title: Must visit Zoo
review: Need to walk & track a lot to see animals.

title: Huff and Puff and here comes the Zoo!!
review: Yes as said this zoo is on a very high altitude. There is a Shuttle service which carries loads of tourists form one particular spot to this zoo. They drop you at a lever from whereon no vehicles are allowed. there's a steep climb to make to the entrance of this zoo. Once Inside you will witness the Himalayan or the Up north species of animals. Although I personally liked the Himalayan Zoo in Darjeeling.

title: A bit tiring but worth it.!
review: To reach zoo, you need to take a cab from 'Moon Travels', located near bus stand. They charge 30 rupees per person for a round trip.

title: Not much animals ...... Its ok
review: It was ok ...... Not much animals but good climb .......

title: Poor animals
review: Well maintained but not many animals and animals are kept in very small enclosures. My heart bled seeing a caged monkey dipping a mango guthli again and again in water and sucking on it.

title: Good one
review: This is a nice place for kids and adults. Feel like on different world. But this is very high. You will have to walk a very long distance to reach here. The cabs will drop you long way before the zoo. Over all very good experience.

title: Good for kids only
review: This place is good for kids. We kinda didn't liked the place much as there are not much animals in here. Few species of birds, deer, tiger and some other snimals.

title: Very well kept and different collection of Himalayan Animals
review: The zoo is at a height to start with and once you get to the it, it even climbs higher. It requires moderate physical capacity activity level to complete the zoo. The place is very well maintained with some very rare collection of Himalayan animals

title: Good to visit this Zoo..
review: This zoo has a large Tiger, Couple of panthers, Deers, Bear. etc.

title: Neat n clean zoo
review: The zoo is neat n clean,its a bit different from other zoo's,as it is on high altitude.Walking on steep roads is a bit difficult though,but still this place is a must visit.

title: Trip to Nainital & Corbet
review: Probably among the best Zoo in India. Spread in vast area. Most of the enclosures have sizable area for animals. You need strong legs are there is considerable level difference between enclosures & bit apart.

title: High Altitude Zoo
review: I had never imagined to find a well maintained zoo with so many animals at Nainital. Nainital's zoo is easy to get too as well unless you aren't used to walking, its a 15-20 minute walk up from the mall road for the fit. Must visit to complete the Nainital experience

title: Too steep and stressful
review: The place is on a high altitude. From a particular point, there is steep walk upto the entry gate. Once you enter the zoo, you need to still keep climbing which was very stressful for us. We didn't enjoy the trip to zoo.

title: NOTHING IN THE NAME OF THE ZOO BUT VERY GOOD VIEW OF NAINITAL FROM THE TOP
review: You can see "ZOO" written on a hilltop from any place in Nainital. The zoo is situated on the top of the hill and there is very good arrangement for taking the tourists at nominal cost of Rs 30 per head from stipulated place in the Nainital. We got our tickets for the ride and pickup from the Naini Lake stoppage. The   vehicle will leave you at the entrance of the zoo, but reaching inside the zoo is really tiresome due to steep road and distance from the stoppage. Not suggested for the old people unless they have some special arrangements for them. But while walking through the steep road one can have the panoramic view of the Nainital town which is really awesome and unforgettable and it will take away all your fatigue. This is the only attraction one can have while visiting the zoo. otherwise inside the zoo you become so tired that you will prefer to sit in benches and admire the beauty of the nature from the hill top. Forget the animals. I could not see any except for some birds which were kept in a cage.

title: Good for Kid or Who never see tiger
review: Good for Kids or Who have never seen tigers. For Zoo, You need to take suttle for Rs 30 and Zoo fee is Rs 50. As compare to fee and the place its not an good idea to go there. But Kids can enjoy a lot.

title: Not a good Experience
review: For me , it was not a good experience as due to heat all the wild animals was sleeping and given 50 rupees per person , I found ticket prices are too steep. Big No for Senior citizens as visit involves lots of walking on steep slope of hill.

title: Well Managed
review: A well designed & managed Zoo. But only a disadvantage is its height. If you are old person better to take rest at the bench because Zoo itself is at very height and you have to move long distances climbing up.

title: Good experience
review: Its situated on high hill and u get amazing view of naini lake from there. Zoo has Siberian tiger which is great attraction. Be prepared to walk.

title: Good collection
review: They have the red panda and himalayan goats...good collection of pheasants as well. However the mountain vulture should be set free, it's dying to come out of the cage. The cage is too small for the vulture. It's like spending rest of your life in a room as small as an airplane toilet.

title: good place to visit
review: nice place to visit in nanital. zoo is open untill 5 pm. must see visits in nanital. view is very good

title: ZOO
review: The zoo is pretty good and there is a Bengali tiger as well. Otherwise you will find more varieties of bird then animals. Good for one time.

title: one of the best zoo
review: Must go while in Nainital......visited in Dec 2015... well maintained place... climate is suithin to most of the animals and birds .. thats why they look so happy and stress free....

title: Average zoo
review: Its an average zoo ,and to reach there is very hactic as we had to wait for long hours down at the bottom for getting into the shuttle service. Very poor management.

title: A Zoo - Good for Kids
review: This zoo is actually at an higher altitude than Nainital. There are taxis which one take from the Mall road for the ride to the Zoo. It is quiet a steep climb from the Parking space to the entrance of the zoo. The zoo is also been developed along the hillside and one needs to be physically fit to see the entire zoo. It is definitely not recommended for older people. The zoo has a decent number of animals and birds. A nice place to go with kids at Nainital.

title: Too steep for young ones and elders
review: Well I didn't find it worth trekking for steep 1.5 kms to see a drained out Siberian ( though we didn't expect a dancing or a smiling canine for sure) and other few avians. If you are planning a trip to Ramnagar you can give this a miss. The animals won't mind after all.

title: Well maintained Zoo at such a height
review: It is an well maintained zoo at such an height. Recommended to take the local shuttle from the Mall road to zoo point at top , because return is very tiring else, retain the transport slip for return. Inside the zoo you should move slowly as the various animals & birds are kept at different height and ups and downs of road are very steep. All the animals are kept well and zoo security is all around. Carry water alongwith.

title: Best attraction of nainital
review: This was the best thing that Nainital had to offer. Zoo is small enough to cover in 3-4 hours walking at a leasurly pace yet one can see a number of big cats and other mountain animals at close quarters. It is as good as the Himalayan Zoo at Darjeeling if not better and is a must visit for anybody going to nainital. Jeep rides provided to & from from Mall road are a icing on the cake.

title: Well maintained zoo
review: Very well maintained zoo. Our kids enjoyed the experience of watching the animals in their natural habitat.

title: Zooo
review: The zoo has a various animals and pheasants. It is very well maintained considering the height at which it is situated. It can be reached by foot or through shuttle service near india hotel  at the mall road. If you are tired then don't go there as inside the zoo, you have to walk a lot and there are steep slopes. Zoo houses a royal bengal tiger, leopards, deer etc. All in all a good zoo.

title: Clean but tiring
review: The Zoo is pretty clean by any standards. The enclosures are pretty large so it is slightly difficult to spot animals. The difficult part is that it is on steep incline. I had a difficult time carrying my 3 year old daughter and walking up the slopes.

title: Nainital Zoo Visit
review: During my first Nanital Visit I was stay in Hotel Maharaja which is near zoo. Outside zoo fooding was good & economical. I will strongly recommend this zoo for the youngsters & children .

title: Good but tiring
review: The zoo is located at very high altitude  so require 2hrs to visit,The Whole Zoo is vertical but one can see tiger, bear and many more animals . It was really good and worth exploring experience

title: Average
review: firstly it is very difficult to find this zoo in nainital. The zoo is very small.you can find a lota of animals there.

title: nice small zoo
review: great small zoo, you can find there a lot of special animals, that are native to india and to the high altitude area.

title: Diverse and exciting
review: Its supposedly the highest altitude zoo in the country. It used to have a snow leopard once, though i think it died. Still worth a visit.

title: Very Exhausting Zoo
review: If you have absolutely free day when you have nothing to do, then you can visit this zoo. You can buy cab ticket from mall road. Cab will drop you half kilometer before the zoo. You have to climb up half km to reach to ticket counter of the zoo. After entering the zoo gate, it’s not the end of your climbing… it’s just the beginning. Keep visiting zoo animals one by one and keep climbing higher. Take rest on benches there and again go higher. It consumes lot of time.. and lot of energy.. and finally when you come back, you will feel exhausted and not be able to visit any other place. So if you are on a short trip, just avoid this.. it’s just an ordinary zoo spread across a sloppy hill.

title: Nice zoo on altitude
review: Nice zoo on altitude.Must go.You can see more than 2 tigers.

title: Need good shoes!
review: The zoo is a very steep walk to get too so ensure good shoes. Once there there are more very steep stairs and climbing to go through the attraction to see the animals. Pram's won't be of any use there. Saw a few animals but as it was starting to get warm, they were all in the shade sleeping. A little disappointing for a toddler.

title: Best Zoo and Biggest Benal Tiger ever seen
review: Very huge in size bengal tiger is the highlight. it is very steep to climb, old people and heart patients are not recommeded to climb. There are other animals like Bear, Cheetah, but Tiger was outstanding we spt more than 15 mins only near the tiger cage. There were 2 of them whilw we visited.

title: A must visit place.
review: The zoo, though it may not be on the travel itinerary of most of the tourist, is the most awesome place to visit. It has some of the most exotic birds and animals. Its very clean and well maintained. One can see most of the animals at a very close angle which is unbelievable. Its not very big but one has  to climb up and down to see animals as it is situated on a mountain. One has also to walk up a certain distance in order to reach there from the last mile connectivity to the zoo by the shuttle.Though the eatables are not allowed inside the zoo, bring some food for yourself as the canteen offers awful food at exorbitant prices.

title: Beautiful Location and Nice Zoo
review: Beautiful Location, Beautiful View and well Maintained zoo .. located at top of Nainital and there are so many birds and animals and Kids really loved it, even the place is too romantic to enjoy the view and sometimes you feel that you are between clouds.

title: Amazing Location But average Zoo
review: As my title goes, the location is really commendable as a government site being firstly made and then well maintained. Really Hats off on that. I felt that the animals and their cage standards were a bit on average side and has vast area of improvement on that.

title: Nice place to spend time
review: This is in a really nice location with lot of woods around. Better than the animals here would be the surroundings around there, very apt to spend time and relax

title: One of hte best Zoo i have been to
review: This is by far one of the zoo i have been to.

title: Really Nice and great experience
review: but its sad we capture animals from natural habited and see them this way, people who also visit are have ill mannered to treat captured animals, each cage must have a security personal to monitor and police these kind of visiters.

title: Zoo at top of the mountain... Incredible effort by forest staff.
review: Around 40 different kind of wild animals and that too at top of the mountain. Incredible ... nice site to visit

title: Amazing collection and well designed zoo
review: The most under rated place in entire Nainital. Zoo itself is at different levels making it very interesting. Tiger, leopard and birds beautiful! Unique collection, all animals are well fed. Samba deer was so massive. Benches placed strategically to sit and watch them. Someone with a vision has made this zoo. It's unlike any other zoo. Absolutely loved it!

title: "zoo in nainital ...new experience on high altitude"
review: good to feel zoo on highest peak of nainital, but as compare with other well managed zoo animal not available though new experience must visit once

title: high atitude zoo
review: high altidude zoo is on a height and to go there you have to take a shuttle which you can get from naki lake,good place for small kids

title: Happy to see little  Cute Panda's
review: Nainital Zoo is somehow different from other zoo's. You can have a close view of tiger as the distance is less as compares to other zoo's I had visited. There are not so much animals there but personally I believe little "Pandas" is one of the greatest attraction in this Zoo. Tickets for the zoo costs only 50 bucks. One can also has beautiful views of Nainital town and Naini Lake.

title: Unique zoo experience
review: The High Altitude Zoo in Nainital is a really unusual experience. When we decided to visit we completely forgot the zoo is on the side of a mountain, so be warned - you do a lot of walking up and down steps and steep walkways - however we ranged in age from 59 - 75, so it can be done. The zoo isn't as well set out as very large zoos, it doesn't appear to have the funding, and the tickets are very cheap. Having said that, the way through the zoo is marked for you, so you can follow the walkways to see all the exhibits. The silver pheasants are beautiful and the large animals are perfectly visible, but the pens for some seem a bit on the small side, by comparison with what we're used to seeing. Some are set out like natural woodland, so it is mixed.There are lovey views out to the mountains and down to the lake and across the town. There is a system of going up to the zoo by car which belongs to the zoo which you access from central Nainital. We found it to be well worthwhile and enjoyed our visit.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Nainital Zoo is quite different with other city zoo , Nainital Zoo has different Himalayan Animals , and secondly gives beautiful views of NAinital town and Naini Lake

title: zoo
review: It is on very high and lots of stairs here and stairs is so straight and it is not too good for whom living in good cities because there is limited animals and entry fee is high

title: Tiger and Leopard!
review: Its too steep and tiring! You need to walk a mountain to see the animals! Senior citizens should avoid it!

title: Located within Nanital. Good Zoo
review: Approachable through road from Nanital Lake. Good attraction for kids and must visit for animal lovers

title: Very Poor
review: Don't visit Nanital Zoo as it is very Terrible and Poor. Located at Very much height with unstructured manner.

title: Wonderful ZOO located at Hight ......
review: It's a nice to walk through this ZOO .... Enjoying cool air coming from Naini lake and watching BIrds and Animals.....

title: NICELY MAINTAINED
review: This is one of the most beautiful and well maintained zoo I have seen so far..... Located at a certain height, it's hard to reach but it's worth the hard walk. The most important attraction is the Bengal Tiger,  which is really amazing.... Must visit in Nainital.

title: Very good
review: Appreciable effort by authorities for conservation of high altitude Himalayan birds and animals.  Kids will like this most.

title: Nice
review: It was really nice. Feels very fresh at that altitude and you can see animals. The animals don't seem pretty healthy/cheerful :(   There is a shared cab from mall road for it which also included return fare.

title: Nice High Altitude Zoo
review: You can visit the Nainital Zoo in govt. shuttle service. The zoo is an average kind. One thing must know that u have to walk a lot of steep roads so be careful.

title: One of its kind !!
review: The Zoo is located on top of a hill..which offers a serene view of complete Nainital..

title: One of the best zoos in India .... courtesy sponsorship from Pepsico !
review: Surprisingly, the best zoos in India are in the most unexpected places, and Nainital is definitely one such place !

title: one of really good zoo
review: must visit tigress Rani ..lal panda..deer..many hill birds...show your family and children beauty of the forest... dont miss tibetian fox and  reindeer .

title: Amazing! Amazing!
review: Enter the zoo and the first thing you have is a mesmerizing encounter with the Majestic Royal Bengal Tiger! You don't want to move ahead but the Nainital Zoo doesn't let you stay in one place, thanks to its overall scenic beauty, the wide range of flora and fauna, and proper maintenance. Of all the zoos that I have ever been to, this is one of the nicest ones.

title: Must visit - for energetic and fit people
review: The High Altitude Zoo, also called the 'Nainital Zoo' is a great place to visit and gives a chance to look at the wildlife up from close.

title: Excellent
review: A surprisingly excellent zoo to be found at such a high altitude. Variety of animals is good. Tiger is beautiful

title: Good Zoo
review: A lot of walking up steep slopes involved. Good collection of animals. Different experience and good views of Nainital lake.

title: Must visit
review: Go only have enough stamina to walk as the path is very steep but you will not be disappointed after seeing the zoo as it is located 2582 metres above...

title: Nothing to see
review: We get to know from genuine source that there is nothing to see in the zoo. You wont find Tiger / Lion etc. You will end up watching birds / rabbit etc. which is common.

title: Enjoy a bit of workout, nature ... White peacock!
review: It was a nice sunny day, a bit cold, however, trip was well worth it .. Not good for people who may have problem walking, uphill, as each exhibit is at higher level than the one before.  Sure, there is a white peacock ..   No ticket for seniors ..

title: Perfect Place to see animals
review: The zoo is awesome and has lots of wild animals. The only bad part is location, it is 1 -1.5 km from mall road. Even once you enter the zoo, there is lot of trekking needs to be done to view all animals.

title: Beautiful !!!!
review: Its an amazing attempt by the authorities to create a world class zoo. For a change the animals are all in good shape and nice. They have good space to survive and grow properly and the zoo is very well-kept. The variety of pheasents is amazing. Red PAnda  is a ultimate value to the collection of animals. Kids would love this place.

title: hight altitude zoo
review: if kids are with you then you will enjoy here .from naniltaal rikshaws go to there at a nominal price of 30 rs .there are a authorized stand there for shuttles

title: Good for kids
review: This place is on a high altitude.Hence senior citizens and heart patients might not be able to climb till the top.

title: Gud zoo
review: Its a good zoo with lot of wild life, one should go when with kids the will love.  I will not advice to people with old age problems like knee joint pain and asthama as one has to walk up and down the hill and walk lots of stairs to see the zoo.

title: One can see the animals very closely,
review: We were totally amazed by the Zoo, it is well maintained, clean. One can see the animals very closely, be it Tiger, Beer, Leopard, Vulture, and all the animals were very clean and active.  It is must visit during Nainital tour.

title: Walk walk & alot of walk
review: Starting with zoo shuttle service available for Rs 30/- each person,

title: Nice place but it will exhaust you
review: Nice place to visit, and they good collection of animals also, but you  have to track steep slope to reach zoo and then again track to see animals. Visited with my kids got dead tired after that.

title: Vertical ZOO - Go if you can climb
review: All the animals were hiding inside. And that too when we have climbed up so hard through the traffic on the way and  through steep steps. The Whole Zoo was actually vertical. So you need to climb and climb managing all that your kids do. Avoid if your are not fit to climb. Atleast if we are sure of seeing the animals fine. But that is not assured. But we had good darshan of a Leapord . Thats it. And the pheasants in the beginning of the zoo. That we lost interest and came down, Even coming down was a little challenging with respect to the steepness.

title: Caged beauty
review: The zoo is located at very high altitude and its really difficult for the people to walk to the zoo. There should be appropriate arrangements for the visitors to commute.

title: Well maintained Zoo
review: You can visit this place with your family and view some endangered species and hilly animals in this zoo

title: Good experience at Nainital zoo
review: I visited nainital zoo on 25 October,15 for first time & experience was ok.this zoo is at high attitude so need 1.5 hrs.to visit it completely.must visit for first timers.As this zoo is on hill itself so I was feeling tired so better to visit in afternoon 3 pm when you can see maximum animals & enjoy mall road in evening.

title: Royal Tiger's Home in Hill
review: various species of birds and animals can be viewed. really enjoying. at high altitude. slightly heavy to walk up.

title: Small zoo
review: This zoo is rather smaller than other zoos but still it is quite refreshing.The leopards are the favourite animals here by people.

title: Spot the Snow  Leopard
review: A good collection of Himalayan wild animals. Walk to it if you can . Spot the snow leopard and see if a Himalayan Eagle is around . Neat and well kept.

title: tough task to reach
review: Though excellently maintained zoo with lot of high altitude animals and birds in it , as situated at a height, I will advise elderly people to avoid it as it is indeed a difficult task to reach there.

title: Excellent
review: You can see a variety of animals in the zoo. However be ready to walk on high altitude slopes. Tigers were wonderful

title: Nice small zoo
review: visited this place with kids in Diwali holidays in Nov15. Zoo is small as compared to other  zoos but very well maintained.

title: Some of the Rarest animals and a great view of nainital.
review: I got a glimpse of tiger and full view of two leopards. Animals are in good shape. Some of the rarest species like Red pandas are well preserved here. A variety of bird species from all over the world are well kept in the cages. A macow, steppe Eagle an Owl and Peacock (white) . Unfortunately, The siberian Tiger, Snow leopard died due to natural causes.

title: Amazing Zoo!
review: this is an amazing Zoo at Nainital. We never thought that we will find a Zoo at Nainital but when we got to know that there is a Zoo, we went straight away for it.

title: Very Nice Collection of Animals!
review: Superb place, a must visit, if you are okay to walk a lot on inclines. Now there is also a shuttle from main Nainital to the Zoo but there is still a lot of walking to do and that too quite inclined

title: A Different zoo
review: Not everyday do you have zoos located on such heights. And then which are systematic, clean and have a nice collection of animals too.

title: Pleasant Surprise. Excellent Location.
review: Mesmerizing. Scenic. Worth visiting. Highly recommended.

title: Good Fun for Children
review: Nice Zoo.

title: Decent place to kill time...!
review: If you are looking for a zoo with lots of animals and birds then this will be a disappointment. Shuttle service is available from Mall Road for zoo.It is located at higher altitude, one has to climb steep approach road to reach the zoo. Inside zoo also, you will have to climb stairs to visit various enclosures for animals.

title: Not worthy to go
review: The height at which it is placed, we were expecting to see lot of birds and animals but what we saw was like few birds which are easily visible everywhere while in animals Tiger/Black Bear were asleep - 2 leopards were found fighting in the cage - even our little Tanish was able to enjoy though he wanted to stay in the Godi all the time due to the heights.

title: Must Go!
review: Special about this zoo is its high altitude so one of its kind experience as you don't find such kind of Zoo anywhere

title: Really good but with limited animal
review: This zoo is situated at a distance of 20 minute walk from Nainital bus stand but I recommend book a taxi he will charge you just 100 r.s and you will be at zoo in no time. Best part of this zoo which I like personally is The Tiger woooww its huge and healthy and beautiful . You will find leopard , wolf, panda, bear, deer and many other beautiful bird . One of the best thing is there will not be much crowd so you can get the best clicks you want and you can see animal for the whole day. If you going to Nainital than this is the place which should be in your list . Live your life friends have a good journey .

title: Good but tiring
review: this is at great height

title: You will see RED PANDA mann!!!!!!! loved that place !
review: What a well maintained zoo ! awesome place for nature lover..  I loved this place as a nature lover not as a zoologist .. Everyone will  love this place ...

title: Thrilling high altitude zoo
review: amazed by extreme location,well organized structure and lovely climate...I have never expected a zoo to have all exceptional awesomeness. I went there downheartedly coz, according to me, going to a zoo on a romantic getaway was not a good idea, but being there, I was amazed. It was really gooood and worth exploring!!!

title: Average
review: Shuttle service will drop you at much before entrance. steep climbing required to see various areas of zoo. will not recommend very elderly or heart/BP patients to visit here.

title: Good time pass
review: Its a mini-trek in itself being on the side of a hill. The main attractions are the Bear, Red Pandas, A tiger and couple of leapords.

title: Not managed well
review: There is a shuttle service run there and you can only go to this place via this shuttle. No taxis, no private vehicles. The place is not managed well. They can do better.

title: Must visit place in Nainital
review: Free up to 12 year kids and very well maintained and All the animals are quite active and healthy .

title: Not worth it
review: First of all its long walk of around 3 KMS steep mountain walk which will tire you there's no options like car or horse available so if You r with a small kid avoid it all animals r lazy n most of the time r sleeping so kids won't enjoy at all.

title: some jungle view.
review: Need to track on high hills, needs extra energy. If you hv never visited any Zoo than only worth going.

title: One of the best
review: It is sure one of the best kept zoo in India...very clean. It is at an altitude and one has to walk a lot especially considering it is steep.  All the animals are nicely kept.

title: Too Much Walking
review: Zoo needs maintenance. Animals and Birds kept there needs care and some even need medical attention. Be ready to climb lots of stairs and walking.

title: Give it a try
review: Good place .....unlike normal zoo...it is at High Altitude.....a lot slopes are there....and too much to walk. But overall a good experience in watching animal so close.

title: Nice experience
review: Nice experience at zoo... Zoo has almost all animals...Try to visit when there is no rain so that you can see the animals.

title: Nainital Zoo - You'll see Tigers for sure
review: The best way to reach zoo is by taking a "Zoo Seva" for Rs 30 per person (both pick and drop included). The ticket for Zoo is Rs 50 for adults and you can see Tiger, Leopard, Wolf, Birds and More. Be Ready for a 20 minute hike and it gets very difficult when you're with a baby.

title: Zoo at Hill Top - Nainital
review: From Nainital Bus stand there is Sharing-Jeep service to this Zoo at Rs.30 [ to & fro ] approx half USD. This is the cheapest way to get to the Zoo as it is amidst the hill top .The entry fee is is a bit expensive according to Indian standards . Zoo is good but needs more maintenance . But really worth a visit . Must Go.

title: amazing variety of birds
review: nature freaks and animal lovers this is the perfect spot for you. and the best part over here is the magnificent sight of the white peacock. you wouldnt believe me but its spotlessly white and you fall in love with that creature as soon as you see it. also there is a wide range of birds and there are other animals too. when going to nainital, this must be on your visiting list

title: Waste of time
review: In this zoo, there was only 1 tiger and 2 leopard. Other than this only monkey,deer available. If you have time to waste then you can visit this place.

title: Amazing Place!
review: Accessible from mall road using shuttle service.Here you can see Tigers,Cheetahs.Deers and many other animals easily.This place is in the Clouds <3 <3

title: Must Visit for everyone
review: This zoo is on hill top. Its quite lovely and neat and clean. You can easy find Tigers especially a white tiger. But be prepared to hike.. its being on the hill, you need to hike a bit. Just go along the indications and you can see the entire zoo in an hour or so.

title: Ideal place for Nature Freaks and Animal Lovers
review: High Altitude zoo is one of the best places to visit in Nainital.Here,you can see a variety of animals like Tiger,Bear,Leopard,Monkey etc.If you are or willing to visit this place, then go for it as it will be economical as there are many other attractions around here like Cave Garden,Lovers' Point,Naini Lake,Mall Road etc.

title: Zoo
review: we are visited the zoo in month of June along with my family zoo are very beautiful. my kids are enjoy the trip

title: Hill Zoo
review: The zoo seems to be ok but the location where it is based is worth watching. Hats off to guys who are maintaining in a hill station such an infrastructure and its quite neet and clean

title: Best WildLife Experience
review: An interesting avenue. A beautiful endeavor by the government to get the sanctuary in the hills. An extension of the Corbett National Park, the Zoo gives its patrons a much needed Wildlife adrenaline rush. What best to enjoy among st the serenity of the nature is the nature's finest creation.

title: High on Top
review: really nice place, we were there in month of Feb, i though this Zoo will be normal like others but when you visit this place and see these animals then you will realize that this is not normal Zoo...

title: Refreshing Zoo
review: Very good location and animals. However being on height, very tiresome to walk upto and inside zoo. However good quality animals.

title: Pleasant views of Nainital
review: This zoo is at height & have to be traveled on foot even after car parking. But is worthy place to visit, offers nice of animals there different from other zoos. It also has kid play center. Get crowded during peak time (May-June)

title: birds will call you
review: must must must go there , you will see many birds ans wild animals here. very close to mall road must wear sports shoe as its on hill .

title: Amazing place for Kids
review: On a height of 1.5Kms from Mall Road, but its real fun of treking.. I would suggest not to take Cabs to go up as you have to wait alot for your turn.. Go ahead nd track.. U'll find breath taking views from top and kids will enjoy the zoo animals as well.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Not very interesting.. Hardly any animals.. Ferry service in MUVs from Mall road to the zoo is badly managed. Only thing that could make you feel good is a close look at the leopard (see pic), kept in the last cage ... At the top of the hill.... But certainly not worth the effort....you could rather go to a proper zoo elsewhere

title: Well maintained
review: Very well maintained Zoo at the high altitute.. the animals are few but very heathy... the Royal Bengal Tigers were a delight..

title: Too Good at such a height
review: Its very very good & its my favourite too.....its amazing

title: Good Zoo
review: Well organised and well designed Zoo from each and every angle you can see good view of Nainital. Zoo animals also very healthy. you can feel actually we are in real forest. Safety also very good.

title: Lots of animals to see!
review: There are a variety of animals to see here like the tiget,cheetah,Panther, bear etc...but the only one thing that you must keep in mind is that you have to walk a great deal here...which is not suitable for small kids and old aged people.This is a must visit place in nainital.

title: Excellent Mountain Zoo
review: Such a great place these mountain zoo's are.Even the darjeeling zoo is fantastic with various type of animals and birds at their disposal.

title: Well maintained (but very few animals)
review: The first place we visited during our trip in Nainital was Zoo and I must say it was a very good start.

title: A Real Zoo
review: One of the Best Zoo of India. Many Animals including White Tigers and Lions.Had a Great Time.Must Visit in Nainital.

title: Not worth the climb
review: As we donot have much to do in any holl station. People with children might be inclined to venture this place. But the only good thing about this place is you can have a gr8 view of naine lake. Otherwise its a steep climb up hill from the place the jeep drops. Its a good 2 kms atleast from that point. Even after that you need climb each time you want to see a animal. So its very exausting. Dont go in morning or afternoon as most animal are sleeping and u will end up cribing.

title: Small zoo big fun
review: Small but very good viewing of majestic animals like tiger and leopards!! Good exercise as well since the climbs are steep. Bad part is on a busy day the cabs are running full and waited for 1.5 hrs to get up to the zoo. DO not try walking up to it since it will exhaust you.

title: Best zoo i've seen so far
review: i went to nainital a couple of years ago with my family and finally i guess its time to write down a review. well after a little deliberation we decided to visit this attraction in nainital and it was the best decision made by us. it is compact yet so grand in its outlook. one can see the majestic tiger at an arm's distance. that was probably the best view of a tiger i've ever had. loved the experience of visiting this zoo. strongly recommended for a family visit.

title: Best in Animals
review: Nainital Zoo has best animals in cages. The tiger is huge 15 ft and I have never seen such one even in jungles. The Snow Leopard catches the eye of all visitors and is very popular among them.

title: Difficult climb...worth it
review: One needs to choose between a steep climb on foot versus a crowded vehical that shuttles both ways.

title: good
review: good oppction to seen but toooo much croud need there car to going zoo many animal there but needtooo much strong leg to seen all all over good oppction

title: lovely tigers
review: if u cant see tigers in jim corbett...here u can see beautiful tiger n tigress...good  zoo...u just need stamina to climb

title: Kids Pradise
review: Good artificial created Zoo!! Clean and well maintained. Kids will enjoy. Only problem is  difficult to reach by walking. at too much height.

title: Difficult climb!
review: You can take your car to a point. But then the problem

title: Bengal Tiger is the highlight
review: Must visit with kids, but you will have to walk a lot uphill even after taking Rs 30 / head shuttle to Zoo. Bengal Tiger, Panther and Red Panda are the highlights of the Zoo. Ideal time in the evening as you will sweat a lot while climbing

title: Simply Amazing
review: Must go place with kids, we preferred to climb up the steep hill, mind U its quite a climb but thats what we went to Nainital for!

title: Few animals - huge trek and climb
review: The zoo visit is like a pilgrimage. First of all, private vehicles do not go near the zoo. There are shuttle jeeps from the other end of the Mall road which take you to the base of the zoo. From this place, there is an arduous climb of ~200 m after which you reach the entrance of the zoo. As if the earlier climb was not enough, the entire zoo is made on hill slopes requiring people to climb up pretty steep slopes for seeing each animal. The best viewings were for a huge vulture and a huge eagle - otherwise animals are limited.

title: Zoo at so high altitude
review: Life in cages is never good, but when we have to protect them from natural dangers, this is the option.

title: A Zoo Well Maintained
review: The Nainital Zoo is on the hill top. While the animals enjoy the chill of the hills, climbing up the stairs is quite a task for people from the plains. Barring the breath factor, it's an awesome experience to be at the top of nainital, you can see almost all the town from there, with the sprawling Naini lake in between.

title: not so good place to be
review: firstly it takes so long to reach dis so high altitude zoo......get in que for cab tickets and den wait for zoo special cabs....secondly even after so much efforts n time u rarely get to see animals like tiger n bear as dey like being in their closed shelter during day time....things may be different if the weather is cloudy but m not sure about it....overall time taken was more than expected for such average experience.....

title: Excellent Zoo
review: Excellent well maintain clean beautiful Zoo on Hills.. we perhaps didn't saw Green Zoo like this. but for senior Citizen its advisable to Avoid the Visit.. too much Walking on Hills .. and also you can see entire lake and city view .

title: White peacock.... Simply amazing
review: If with young children,  this zoo is a must see place.  Though you have to climb a lot upto the entry and also beyond at each cage,  it is worth it once you see the Tiger,  Leopard and the fantastic colourful birds.

title: Zoom in Zoom out in Zoo
review: Naintal Zoo has been built on a hill overlooking the Naini lake with beautiful views of other mountains too. It is India’s one of the highest altitude zoos, and because of that one needs to climb the steep slopes and steps in between, it becomes a daunting task to reach the zoo. It is tiring yet adventures to climb into the by lanes of Nainital and reach the zoo . Other option is one can go by local taxi right up to the top. Entry fee of 50 for adult and 20 for kids is to keep the zoo clean and well maintained. We could see Bengal tiger, leopard up close and personal, Black Himalayan bear, wolfs, Barking deer and more. There were variety of peasants, eagle, owls  and other breed birds too.  Everywhere there was marking and boards with details so that one cannot miss anything. At entry/exit point there was one food joint which serves sandwiches, chowmin , chips, chocolates, cold drinks. So overall different experience than any other zoo.

title: A complete disaster.
review: First of all don't be misguided bt the advertisements about the zoo being a wonderful place.

title: Great Zoo
review: we liked this place very much. well  maintainted. steep climb, little difficult for old & unfit . lot of animals including tiger, himalayan bear etc.

title: Total waste of time, money, and most importantly  - energy.
review: This has been my second visit to this place. The earlier visit was good, somehow. This one was terrible. Firstly, waiting for around 2 - 3 hours for the shuttle service to the zoo.

title: Walking and Watching Zoo
review: Good activity after breakfast especially if  you are with kids.

title: Good one
review: This is a good zoo with many animals. Elder people & heart patients should stay away because of high altitude.

title: Worth a visit
review: well maintained zoo--only issue is walking on inclines. good view of tigers, lot of birds, monkeys, deer and sambhar. rest areas across which helps a lot--but tough for elderly people to walk around

title: Great place for kids
review: As the name suggests, it is at a very high altitude. Getting up to the drop zone by share cab services provided by the zoo is just half of it.

title: Not worth
review: Lot of trouble, unnecessary walking and climbing on top of hills. Animals enclosures are very small, specially tiger and panthor very in a small cage. NOT WORTH

title: Entertainment with Knowledge
review: The zoo is located approximately at 1.5 Km from the Mall road. However the Road to the zoo is very steep hence people pay Rs 30/- for to and fro to the zoo. The Jeep facility is available on the Mall road itself. People who are really athletic would regret paying Rs 30/- INR.

title: Too much climbing
review: The zoo is good. One gets to see a lot of high altitude animals. It is really nice going around it. Only drawback is, one has to climb too much. I went on because I had started but can't go again.

title: Highly recommend for everst climber
review: U should b rock climber to visit very few animal

title: really terrible
review: this zoo is for rock climbers not for family.animals are less that you will see.strongly recommended dont go there.

title: awhy visit zoo, when you can spend time at others places too
review: there is nothing good about this zoo. If you love to travel such steep ways, then better go to Vaishno devi. You can watch zoo at your places, which ofcourse will be better than this(I am referring here Delhi Zoo :)).

title: Nainitaal zoo k visit
review: Nainital zoo ay very high altitude lot if trekking n not many animals to see few pheasant n a tiger from Jim Corbet npark. Not for senior citizens

title: ZOO- Fun tym
review: Zoo is located at quite a distance 1.5-2 km and the road is very steep , so if you are with a family hire a vehicle...

title: Kids will Love it !!
review: If you are in Nainital with your kids, you must visit this zoo, Lots of Animals, Wide variety of species of birds, Big wild Cats like leopards and Tiger are there. Show Stopper is the White Peacock. Only Downside is that lots of walking is to be done that too on slopes, surely not easy for aged people.

title: Nice place to spend half a day
review: If you have kids, this is a nice place to spend half a day. They have a good collection of animals, including a white tiger named Kunal.

title: nice stepledder pattern zoo...unique experience
review: its a different type of zoo..u can expand a quality time with your children ..don't miss it..there will  be a unique experience

title: Hilly Zoo!!
review: Very nicely maintained zoo. most of the people haven't  seen hilly zoo... it was a great place to spend 2-3 hrs.

title: children's choice
review: our kid's wanted to see it,

title: Good place for children.. Adults too..
review: I go to this zoo every time I visit Nainital. Its on hill, well maintained, has variety of animals. I specially love tiger and snow leopard. You can even sit and rest around because it has lovely view. Children will definitely love it.

title: Worth a visit
review: The local cabbies do cover it as part of their 'points'.  However it is advisable to go to the zoo separately.

title: Superb..
review: Must visit.. beautiful surroundings.. amazing variety of wild animals... shuttle service available at economical cost.. zoo is very well maintained..

title: Ok as far as zoos go
review: I am not a fan of captive animals being displayed for human amusement and don't usually visit zoos but did end up going to this one. It's ok for a zoo. The enclosures are not brilliant but at least most of them are more than cages. The tiger looked lacklustre and the wolves both looked traumatised running up and down the fence manically which is a sign of stress. The birds all seemed to have very limited areas for living and were just sat on their perches. We went for purely selfish reasons to see the Himalayan animals we were most unlikely to see in the wild like black bear which we did, but ended up feeling very sorry for the animals and thinking we should not have gone. The animals did all look in good condition though so I don't have anything to complain about in their care except on the grounds of their being captive and in small environments.

title: Keep climbing
review: It has to be a full day's activity by taking the first possible Car shuttle at around 0930 hrs and the young can take a 15-20 minutes uphill walk, Senior citizen have free entry but their health & will power should be taken into account.

title: lovely    zooooooooo,
review: zoo was awesome.to see animals at high altitude in cages is awesome.

title: Well maintained
review: Hello, this place is on top the hill and can have a full view of Nainital. Although there are less animals its nice & especially well maintained. But they cater wide variety.

title: Just like any other zoo.
review: Apart from few species which are found at high altitude, rest of the things are just like any other zoo. One has too walk (or climb) the slop to see different animals. The view of Naini lake and the city is good from the zoo. Panda and Tibetan Wolf were good to see.

title: Good but tiring
review: It was fun to be there and see animals at the hills. But its definately so so tiring. We saw few animals like tiger, leopard, black bear and more. My daughter enjoyed it a lot.

title: Tigersssss beware
review: Best zoo so up close with royal bengal tigers scary and Gods wonderful creation can be seen from 4 feet away!!!!

title: Unlike other Indian Zoos its clean and beautiful
review: Overall its a nice family trip destination. Just stone throw's away from the Mall road. its a good place to visit while in nainital either with friends or with family.

title: you will get tired really at height
review: nice zoo and have animals like tiger,dears,beers,sambhars etc, avoid if you can not climb are having walking problems.

title: Godd views and fun place to visit
review: Its a good place to visit with the family (and kids especially).Its close to the Nainital and is walk-able (at least for the young) or else you can take a taxi that takes 15-20 bucks to take you there.

title: You'll find some animals and birds but got to walk a lot rather climb a lot!
review: Children would enjoy it. Some animals and birds are there but you should be prepared to walk on the hill!! Must eat pakodas at the entrance of the zoo!!

title: Nice place
review: refreshing to see Royal Bengal Tiger... Simply wow ....

title: A nice place
review: Suitated at a high altitude, the zoo is a good attraction, but reaching the zoo was quiet cumbersome....had to wait for more than 30 minutes for the taxi to pick up as well, not many facilities are available there for travellers.

title: I m loving it
review: In the zoo there is a snow leopard name mohan. It is two years old and very lovely creature..it had lost his mother when only 15 days old...nainital zoo authorities take this little cub there and now it is a big cat.... lovely place to visit...lots of leopards...easily visible...and a bengal tigre.... some other animals also

title: Good for a short visit
review: Good for a short visit, kids love the colorful birds and tiger. But be ready to sweat as the zoo is spread across uneven terrain.

title: ZOO ON TOP
review: the nainital zoo is on the top - after a steep climb. It harbours many animals - and loooks well maintained in this small hilly state of natural calamities, compared to its couterparts in many state capitals

title: A steep walk to the Zoo entrance and end with little disappointment
review: Good for young members as you may have to walk uphill before u reach the zoo. In April they were renovating the zoo, hence we could not ve seen the snow leopard. Nothing great to see other than the 2 bears which is in a open enclosure and if you miss tigers you got to see a lot of them here. Big ones..Star attraction si a brown bear or cat, a old diseased vulture and lot of pheasants. But difficult to take snaps as several iron meshes are there and spoil the view. Overall an average place and a miss is not disappointing.

title: High Altitude, One of a kind Zoo
review: Neat & Clean, high Altitude Zoo. If you don't mind walking uphill for a few minutes, it is every bit worth your time. The zoo is well kept and all the animals seemed to be healthy. Good place for kids. Red panda, Bengal tiger,leopard , Tibetan wolf, white peacock are some of the  main attractions

title: Great but tiresome
review: It is one of its kind... I visited this along with my wife and my one year old kid. Obviously i was carrying my kiddo. We took zoo shuttle service from Mall road which took us to mid way of a very steep  uphill ride. From there one has walk around 100mts of similar steep uphill road to reach ticket counter.  Road is some time occupied by monkey and langoors.

title: awesome zoo at hill station
review: lot of different animals in there.. well maintained.. we were pleasantly surprised to see different species there.. this zoo is bit difficult to scale but once you reach you tend to enjoy every bit of it

title: Very high altitude...zoo
review: The zoo is on a mountain and there is shuttle service available from mall road at Rs30 per person. Entry fee is 50 per person. Inside the zoo u have to walk a lot that too upward on a hill.
