But you will get to see a lot of species like Bengal tiger, leopard, sambhar, black bear etc. Also view from top is mesmerizing. U can also enjy some snacks at the gate of zoo with a great view. Do take some drinking water when going here.

title: hard work to spot something...
review: It's a cardio workup to explore this zoo at mountain top.

title: Good place for Kids
review: The zoo is well maintained and clean. Animal are healthy and clean.

title: Snow Leopard
review: Our main aim to visit the Zoo was to see the snow Leopard. You can get a taxi from mall road for to & fro for Rs. 30 per person. Zoo is well maintained & you can feel this by looking around once you are inside. it's really clean.

title: A very poorly maintained Zoo
review: It's a good example of a good location , good environment , good weather and still being the worst maintained Zoo. If you have seen  the Zoo at Kufri (near Simla) , then it's miles away from that quality.

title: A Little High
review: Please take the taxis rite upto the gate of the zoo as the climb is very steep. The variety of animals here is not much but all the hilly animals are present.

title: super zoo in a hill station
review: never imagined something of this standard in nainital. the zoo is well kept and all the animals seemed to be healthy. I saw Royal Bengal tiger, Tibetian wolf, Sambhar deer, Bear, Leopard and many birds.

title: well maintained high altitide zoo
review: Very good zoo situated at high altitude. Self guided yellow mark there to guide you. you find Wolf, Leopards, tiger, barking deer, Himalaya bear, monkey, red panda, vulture and lots of pheasants. I am sure kids enjoy it lot. only thing is we have to walk so much up and down on hill. To reach there You can find shuttle from mall road.

title: Must see one of a kind zoo.
review: Neat & clean zoo. Red panda, tiger,leopard ,white peacock are main attraction . climb is steep so elders will face a problem . there is a drop&pickup facility available at mall rd for rs30/head.

title: Nice
review: Though it is built at an altitude that requires to step up to check every cage but the walk was worth it. Covered good number of animals and a large variety of pheasants and birds. Must go if you are travelling with kids

title: kids love it
review: not good for people who hate to walk, kids enjoyed every part of it, birds were very beautifull and also quite a decent variety, signages and directions were quite clear

title: Seems nice
review: This seems a nice zoo, with good views of town. I think some of the cages were a little small and a few monkeys looked unhappy, but overall they have made a good attempt to look after the animals well I think. Highlights include tigers, black bears and leopards. They also have lots of birds and some deer.

title: Zoo is too good
review: The Nainital high altitude zoo is a good one. Well kept and condition of the animals, birds is very good. Couple of Tigers and a himalayan bear add to the x factor. You can spend about an Hour here.

title: Good zoo. Fun for kids!
review: Nainital zoo - India's only high altitude zoo. Located close to mall road/lake, the zoo has an entry fee of Rs. 50 for adult and Rs. 20 for child. The zoo is on a very high altitude which needs us to climb steep slopes. There are rest benches at frequent intervals for taking a recess ;) At first sight it doesn't give a look of a zoo. It resembles more like a house. The zoo is well guided with a yellow arrow marks on the floor enabling self guidance to the visitors. There are few places where the marks are crossed indicating no entry zones. Brilliant idea. We could see some peasants with different coloured tails, bengal tiger (oh my god, there were 2 tigers. Both were so big and ferrocious), leopards, red panda, bears, sambar, etc. Zoo is well maintained and good spend if visited with kids. They will love it.

title: going to the wild
review: A must visit place cos there a lot of animals to explore and also tough climb cos its on the top of the hill....take a taxi and while returning take stirs that is opposite to the zoo main gate...save bucks

title: Another decent place to visit in nainital
review: A bit over rated to be one of the largest high altitude zoo, but not as bad as some of the reviews might suggest. The zoo has couple of man-eaters, leopard, himalayan bear. Recently the zoo got a pair of red pandas that are not easily found in india. So if you want to spend a few hours away from nainital then it is a decent place.

title: zoo
review: too much of a trek to the top, although there are shared taxi rides to the top for 30 INR, then u have to walk for 5 more minutes to reach the zoo entrance, senior citizen's are exempted from fee, but it a torture for them to walk all the way up... not many varieties of animals & it"s a small zoo...

title: Nice zoo at such an altitude
review: The best attraction here is the white peacock and tiger couple.

title: Beauty and Beast !!!
review: It has variety of Mammals and Pheasants apart from rich and diverse flora and fauna. Kids enjoyed a lot after seeing Royal Bengal Tiger. Other animals seen were Himalayan bear, Sambar, Deer, Wolf, Snow Leopard, Goral, Japanese macquae and various pheasants. The route is self guided through yellow arrows and yellow cross where not to go. Better to visit around 10-12 am when animals are fresh. In noon they go to sleep. Up walk to zoo is very tiring and steep. Be careful with elders and kids!!

title: Amazing Zoo
review: Zoo has a good species of birds & Animals. The Tigers made the kids go crazy. Kids enjoyed a lot. Also the Beautiful Nainital city can be viewed from the Zoo

title: Compact zoo
review: A small compact zoo, nicely kept. Awesome being so close to the tigers, wish they had more space. A good challenging walk.

title: not good not bad
review: its an high altitude zoo on the top of the hill.u need a vehicle and well trained driver to reach there.zoo has different birds,bengal tiger,leopard,bear,deer etc.its a good place for single visit with kids.if u have good stamin then this place is for you.roads inside zoo are very steep climb.

title: good but not must to see
review: it is good beacuse of hieght,,,,but not so many animals there.....if u are going there take a bottel of water nd some chips or other food to eat,,beacuse it is on height,,,nd will be thirsty nd hungry so.....take care

title: Cleanest Zoo
review: This is brilliant. Very clean, tidy and well maintained zoo. You get to see variety of animals and birds too. The Royal bengal tiger is magnificent. The zoo is very clean and no foul smell around. You have to move higher on the slope as you go on watching the animals and birds. A little tiring but it is worth it

title: Nice zoo
review: The zoo is at a very high altitude and you need to walk a lot to see the animals. Its well kept and nice outing if you have a kid. but be ready to walk up and down the hill. Its really worth it.

title: Amazing
review: I had an amazing experience. At first i was not that excited but once i bought the ticket and went into the zoo i had so much fun that it became the highlights of my trip. This is one of the best maintained zoo. Very clean.

title: Worth a visit
review: I've been to this place 5 years back and this time took my kids. Didn't do the full round since they got tired but managed to see the tigers awake and walking about. The zoo is very well kept. Mind you, it is an exhausting trip with a lot of steep inclines on the way to the zoo and inside it.

title: Decent zoo
review: Pretty close to Naini lake. There is a shuttle service which is provided by the zoo (starts near Indian hotel and charges about Rs 30 per person).

title: Best Zoo
review: Best Zoo I have ever seen. Clean animals at high attitude but reaching there is a task and you need to walk a lot. Animals are kept in big and clean cages

title: Good, but not worth the effort
review: There is a good numbers of animals and birds in this zoo, but walking or rather climbing really drains you and can be difficult in the cold.

title: Nice zoo!!
review: Very nice zoo with some rare species of animals. Animals were not so many in number but species were rare non that I found in any other zoo. Although the bengal tiger was asleep all the time but there were a lot of panther and pheasants. The rare thing was the white peacock.

title: A treasure - must visit
review: This is a must visit for any inquisitive mind. There are rare species of animals to be seen here but the most spectacular are the birds. The zoo houses pheasants from China, India, Myanmar etc and the colorful birds are mesmerizing.

title: Amazing place, well maintained, great views
review: Around 1-1.2 kms from the mall road, this Zoo is a hidden paradise of sorts. Range of animals from Tiger, Leopards, Black Bear, Barking Dear, etc here offer a exciting experience to children and adults alike. One can take a shuttle from the Mall Road (opposite India Hotel), and for Rs. 30 per adult get to/fro transport. Obviously its a high altitude zoo so the roads are quite steep, even inside the zoo one has to walk on steep pathways. The entry ticket is Rs. 50 per adult.

title: Beautiful birds
review: We walked whole way up to the zoo and it is fun... There was a babbar sher who is now dead, am just lucky to have seen it. Loved the colorful birds, white peacock, snow leopards and tigers. It is worth the visit... Man can never replicate the nature, live example is the colors on those birds.. ABSOLUTE BEAUTY..!!

title: quaint
review: nice zoo, plenty of leopards (probably rescued/captured from the local forests given the high density of leopards around that area),  a tiger that you can see from close. contains some of the local fauna (barking deer, ghoral, doral, pine martens, himalayan civet) but we mainly visited to see the siberian tiger and snow leopard but unfortunately both had died. if we knew that we probably would not have visited since we those were the two unique cats the zoo were supposed to have.

title: High Altitude Zoo
review: Once of the Finest Collection of Exquisite Birds. Unbelievably Hugh Zoo on Mountain Top. Tiger, Bears, Leopards, Panthers, and much more. A must visit for family with kids of 8- 18. People who have walking up ascending slops please avoid.

title: The little Zoo with Big Collection!
review: As part of my winter trip to the hills, we visited this Zoo during our halt at Nainital esp for the benefit of our 5 yr old son. He surely was excited but by the end of it, so were my wife and me. A zoo spread in a small area along the gradient (which means one has to walk uphill a lot so make sure you arent very tired before the trip), there is an awesome collection of animals and birds here. Our favourite were ofcourse the huge Bengal Tigers (What a magnificent Beast indeed) amongst the animals and the varied variety of multi coloured beautiful pheasants and ofcourse the snow white peacock....A must visit whilst at Nainital

title: good zoo
review: well i hope the government will make zoos in other hill stations also thereby showcasing the wonderful animals of the mountains...this is a nice little zoo with ascending slopes so avoid if you cannot walk uphill...they used to have a Siberian tiger which was like the star attraction..they have leopards and other animals...the kids surely have a nice time...some enclosures are small and dingy..they have a variety of birds also..

title: Nainital ZOO: Extremely beautiful and Clean
review: Went to visit zoo.

title: oh my god it was nice but very high...
review: I was not able to visit all the sections of the zoo as it was very high...I got my breath stuck...please take a lot of time to climb the zoo...as we had many places to visit we had to hurry which really made it tough..

title: Zoo in the Sky
review: We saw several Zoo in other cities, this one is really different, well maintained, variety of birds, wild animals, high on hills with clouds all around made us feel as if it's a Zoo in the Sky.  However aged a person, he/she will become a kid n enjoy watching the birds n animals here and would thank the almighty for offering such a lovely nature around us to live our life!  Hats-off to the people who maintain it with huge efforts.  One of the best part is there is transportation from the Naini Lake available at just Rs.30/- per person.

title: excellent
review: my child just enjoyed the place.. n we enjoyed the scenery too..dont wear high heels n go..better go in sport shoes..otherwise u wont enjoy the place..

title: Must for Kids
review: It’s a high altitude zoo in Nainital. A steep high road of about 2 Kms from Mall Road takes you to zoo. Be ready to walk for even higher points as wild animals are kept at different places. You get to see Tiger, Bear, Leopard besides other animals and birds. Good place to go with kids. They will definitely enjoy.

title: Not worth the time and pain!
review: Improperly maintained facility.

title: Tigers den
review: Two beautiful tigers and plenty of leopards,some rare birds like the white peacock,sambhar,deer,fox,hens, and a nice walk.

title: a pleasant surprise
review: Last year i had visited this zoo with my family. At the first instance i was unwilling to visit this place as i had in my mind that it is "just another zoo". However my husband insisted that we should go for my 4 year old daughter's delight and it really paid off. It was an amazing place.

title: Hidden treasure of Nainital
review: This is a great place for children and adults alike in Nainital..or probably in India..

title: regret my visit
review: though it's location is breath-taking.. we were sad to look at the condition of the animals... the tigers cage was specially too small ...and there were horrible people making voices to irritate the helpless animals....plus it involves too much of walking that to upward slant.

title: only for children
review: too climbing, only for children not for old people because climbing

title: too hyped
review: its a tedious walk from the parking lot and you better be in extreme fitness if you want to go through the whole zoo because as you enter you have to continue walking uphill to each and every enclosure.

title: Best Zoo I have visited in India.
review: Best zoo, well marked path, well managed, animal's enclosure are clean. Overall good experience. Your vehicle drop you at a distance from where you have to walk for nearly 200 mtrs but its a steep climb.

title: trek up to an average zoo !
review: We trekked up to the zoo with family from main nainital mall road where most people were lined up to take a car ride that  costs 30/- per person return fair. It took us about half hour with an ice-cream break. Cars drop you upto a point from where have to walk up & it does get tiring.

title: you should see this
review: In hill stations there is not much you can see and we go there to enjoy time with our partner or family. .  This is the place where you can see something else also . . the animals are from cold region and not normally you found somewhere else. .  its at height and it seems pleasant there.. .  if you have time for sightseeing then you must include this.

title: "a joy ride for children"
review: i visited this place with my family during recent visit of nainital. it is accessible through zoo cab service from mall road. after getting there anyone will get a birds eye view of nainital. there are some species of birds and animals which will surprise you. my children enjoyed the place very much and finally i would say it is a must watch place.

title: One should see it.
review: The main attraction of the zoo are the tigers. View from the zoo of the lake & city is pretty. Avoid walking up to the zoo as it is very tiring. The tigers are healthy & the bengal tiger is huge.One should visit it. Not a waste of time at all.

title: Its Very High
review: Zoo is good, the first thing you will see is leopard and then more but its very high - get ready to be tired soon.

title: Too much climbing
review: Here is a zoo where to see every animal you require to make a lot of effort. There is very steep climbing to reach every cage and is not good for weak hearted people. However the quality of animals is very good especially the Tiger and Leopard

title: Nice Experience!
review: Its a newly built Zoo & is properly maintained. It has Tigers, Himalayan Black Bear, Birds etc But being on Hill stations it is quite steep & also not recommended for senior citizens as roaming in the Zoo will take your breadth out.

title: High Altitude
review: This zoo is different from other zoos. It is located at hill, so if you get tired easily on hill climbing please ignore, because the hight of zoo is really good.

title: amazing
review: the zoo is spectacular but make sure you can walk, walk and walk.... no vehicles are available after the drop point and a walk around the zoo is guaranteed to be equivalent to a 5 day work out... but the experience is unforgettable and simply amazing

title: Nice place for kids to see
review: We went to the High Altitude Zoo when we visited Nainital. Had kids 3 and 5 year old. Our kids enjoyed it to the hilt. Zoo had many varieties of birds and animals. Had a chance to see tiger and leopard in their full glory. Overall enjoyed our brief visit to the zoo. Must go if your are with kids.

title: great place but u need a lot of stamina
review: zoo cabs take u to the zoo and bring back for Rs 30 pp. zoo is at great height and one has to face steep ascent . many tourists are unable to see all. one must see tiger couple . very healthy beasts. another attraction is chinese pheasants (birds). carry water bottle, umbrella and a good camera. when u come down u can have yummy fruit chaat. go for all mango. its heavenly

title: Must Visit
review: Involves a steep drive up the hill by local shuttle taxis. Might need to wait in long queues. Amazing animals. Well maintained. Will need to climb a lot as animals are located at different heights, so see if your small kids can walk the height. Lovely views.

title: Ready to tire yourself
review: The zoo and animals are really worth visiting just that it is on great height and there are level differences so ready to tire yourself

title: Steep Climbing
review: if u r in leisure mood of Hill Station, it will be a atrocious you to visit the zoo, as it is located on Hills and you have to walk much on steep climbing, which you may not find worth to visit. Not very special about the zoo, to visit...

title: Amazing zoo
review: very well designed zoo and has a variety of animals. Have twice been to Nainital ( abeautiful place) and both times have visited the zoo

title: Close up view of  of wild animals....too much climbing
review: The zoo is worth a visit if u have young kids who have not seen tiger and leopards at close range. There is Himalayan bear, family of leopards, beautiful pheasants and most of them seem to be camera friendly and not shy!

title: Best zoo!
review: There are Govt jeeps that takes you to the Zoo gate but the main steep walk has to be down by you. There are few animals like the tiger, leopard, goral, bears, birds, etc. the best thing is that these animals have been given the most natural habitat. the view of nainital is amzing from the zoo. There are plenty of view points to enjoy. The zoo has been well maintained.

title: Highly Overrated
review: The was very disappointing, to say the least. Firstly in order to get to the Zoo you need to take the cab from Mall Road, from a designated place.. but if you reach this place later than 10:00AM in the morning, be sure to encounter huge crowd waiting for the cabs.. The animals are either sleepy or heavily caged. Delhi Zoo is much much better. The walking is very very tedious in zoo due to the steep climbs..

title: Zoo in the mountains
review: You can see tiger, leopards, black bear and some pheasant but be ready for steep climbs as the way to zoo is all climbing. If you are with children and a wildlife lover you will enjoy it but the waiting for the free shuttle service to & for from the mall road to the zoo is too long especially during the holiday season.

title: Well maintained Animals
review: There are only two high altitude zoo's in India, this being one of them.

title: Worth watching..
review: This was the only thing i liked in Nainital. It was very much clean and u can get wonderfull scenic view of the hill station.

title: Bad!!!
review: The place is pathetic! Needs a lot of effort to go to various levels on the zoo. But on reaching you will see sorrowful state of the animals. Can be avoided altogether. It has a couple of birds, a lonely tiger, 3-4 leopards and a couple of deers. Better to watch these animals live in Corbett instead!! Senior citizens must avoid!! While govt employees go with their vehicles right upto the gate, the shuttle for others stops at a point from where it takes another 7-10 mins to walk up the slopes. Save your time and money!!

title: Very Good place at very high altitude
review: A must visit place. It is unique as it is at a height. Plenty of animals & birds. Children Will definitely like it

title: Go for the view and special high altitude animals
review: It doesn't give a great feeling watching animals confined in a small place but still it is ahome to them. You can see the siberian tiger, wolves and other animals. Nice for the young ones. The view from the top of the zoo is amazing. If you are in nainital then don't miss it.

title: You need to trek to see this zoo
review: You will get shared taxi's to reach the zoo. There is one pickup point near "Everest" hotel. Or any local person (except some cab guy ;) about shared taxis & they will tell you from where to get it. The zoo is ok. It's only for people who love walking & trekking. All the animal sheds are at high altitude & you need to be really fit to cover them all. There are some good animals & birds to see. You get a really nice view of Naini lake from here. There are some eateries near the ticket counter & also a fun area for kids. Overall a time pass option. Can be ignored if you have a really tight schedule or trip plan.

title: Nice experience .. Great view of city from here !
review: Got the shared taxi's from Mall road and reached .. but then u still need to trek a lot, so if you love trekking u can even go for the same instead of zoo. Zoo is kind of ok but the high altitude and great views make this place worth a visit. It is within the city limits and definitely should make it to your list when you visit Nainital

title: Admirable..achievement for the managers..
review: This is really a wonder...in a place where you would least expect it...but the zoo..has been kept in such good shape..the Tigers..are obviously the highlight...The ZOO reminds us of an old adage..."where theres a will..theres a way.."..hats off to the management...

title: Great zoo at an amazing height
review: great view and collection of species.

title: zoo
review: supeerb height it is located at..what a view of the hill station ..

title: Nicely maintained place
review: One of the main attraction of the city. Its has many animal and birds including Bengal tiger, Snow monkeys, Deer's. Nicely maintained healthy animals. And the one thing it offers its visitors is you can adopt any animal for a year. Entry fee is Rs. 50/-, and it stays closed on Mondays. View of the city from the zoo is Breathtaking. It has parking space too for few vehicles.Overall good place for families with kids.

title: Missed the Siberian Tiger
review: The High Altitude Zoo in Nainital is a small but well maintained zoo. It has numerous birds and animals including Bengal Tiger and Sloth Bear. This zoo also had a Siberian Tiger before which is no more there. We missed the Siberian Tiger. Overall a nice place to visit in Nainital

title: a good experience for kids
review: situated on the very top of the hill , it commands awesome views of the naini lake and the nearby areas , it is an uphill stiff walk and has got very good specimens of himalayan birds , and royal bengal tigers and snow leopards ....good place to visit

title: High Altitude Bliss!
review: The fun part in visiting this Zoo is the trek itself. From the mall road, it's a trek of around a mile and takes around 20-30 mins. The view of the lake and the town along the trek is brilliant.. The trek is refreshing. The zoo as mentioned is a High Altitude zoo. It houses some very beautiful specimens of the bird, herbivore and carnivore species. The highlights of the zoo are the Tiger couple, which is awesome in its majesticity. The idling leopards, and the giant deers.

title: Awsome
review: Never seen the Siberian tiger before and it was so close unbelievable but the zoo is for physically fit people because it is really high too much for senior citizens but I have seen too many zoos in our country (Kolkata; Delhi' Jaipur' chandigarh' Orissa' ) but this one is best

title: Waste of time
review: As zoos go, this is about the smallest that I have ever seen. The climb to the zoo is up a steep hill which barely has space for one car to pass. When you reach the parking, then you realize that there is more climbing to be done just to reach the ticket counter and then you need to keep climbing up to see the main zoo. Apart from couple of tigers, 3 leopards and a pair of himalayan bear, there is actually not much else to see. The vaunted snow leopard cage is empty.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Well maintained grounds & cages/enclosures. Animals looked Healthy.

title: Close Look of Bengal Tiger
review: This place is on very height and accessible by shared cab available at regular from Mall Road. Very nice place. Best part is very close look of Bengal Tiger Pair and Leopard. Some paths inside are very steep and hence little tough for small kids and elderly persons. Views are good from this very height.My kids enjoyed the walking (I should say climbing) through the Zoo and covered entire area.

title: Not a must
review: Avoid if you are tired as you have to walk a lot that too uphill. Not advised for elders. Once you are there then there are  many animals like the Royal Bengal tiger, Cheetahs, bears etc. Down the way from the zoo you can rest at the cemented boundaries and have some snacks sold by local vendors. It is not a must to visit this place

title: very tirring trek
review: couldnt njoy much as the trek is really tiring to the animal enclosures. but it amazes one to see the facility at such height!

title: They will make you walk a lot
review: The animals are there to see but you have to walk a lot and that to on the hills so might be a bit exhausting

title: Zoo
review: I have been made to believe that this Zoo is at the highest altitude in the World. Though the walk is tough but the Zoo is very well maintained with ample animals at display.

title: Nice place
review: Taxi Shuttle is there from India Hotel up to Zoo and back. We could see Royal Bengal Tiger and so many other animals / birds. It is worth visiting.

title: absolute must for children.... ( seniors away..)
review: i cant say i have seen a better zoo in India

title: Must visit
review: Govind Ballabh Pant High altitude zoo in Nainital is a must visit. With its pair of Royal Bengal Tigers, its worth the steep climb. The bird's eye view of the eye shaped lake(Naini lake) from the zoo is wonderful. The flora & fauna at the zoo is very nicely arranged in the small area it has and makes it easier for a quick visit.

title: Very good zoo - Awesome Tigers, Leopards and variety of Birds.
review: Its a provate zoo which works on sponsorships from various listed co.s and other organisations. The view of the city from here is also breathtaking. Must visit if you are in Nainital. The animals and birds are in excellent condition and well taken care off.

title: Wildlife...
review: Pt. G.B. Pant High Altitude Zoo: Opened in 1994, it is one of the two High altitude Zoo in India, Second is in Darjeeling, West Bengal. It houses various Phesants e.g. Kaleej Phesant etc.; high altitude endangered Mammals like Siberian Tiger, Snow Leopard, Goat Antelope-Ghooral and Serao etc. The animals are according to their habitat altitude, e.g. Snow Leopard is kept on the highest point.

title: A very well maintained Zoo
review: A must visit if you are here in Nainital with family. Though it is a bit tiring since its on the top of the hill and involve a lot of walking but worth going as you will get to see a variety of animal and a great view.

title: Good but not great
review: There are many cages which are empty and within the cage too the maintenance doesnt seem to be all that good. You can see the Bengal Tiger and leopards. Children would certainly like it over here as with all the zoos. Have to say that the one at Darjeeling on a similar concept of altitude zoo was a better place. Also, for those not to keen on walking and climbing, its a place to avoid. Theres quite a bit of stiff climb here. An okay place

title: Too steep
review: Not too many animals(Tiger/Leopard and Bear) ,rest all were birds it was too steep to walk with kids.

title: Not a big zoo,
review: Its a very small zoo with few animals like pheasants, birds and deer.

title: nice zoo
review: This zoo was full of animals living at a high altitude, It's a couple of kms upward so if u don't want to walk, get a taxi, a certain company exactly, who has a desk rigth where the zoo road originates from the main street. For 30 rs they bring up and will bring back. You have to pay in advance and you get a ticket, you can use that for the ride coming back. When it stops, one sill has to walk some distance on a very steep road but it's ok. I don't remember the entry fee, but the zoo tickets are ridiculously cheap and are totally worth it. Luckily there wasn't a big crowd and I really enjoyed the zoo :) I felt i belonged to it, I was one of the animals, because groups of young Indian  guys kept taking picture of me ,too :))

title: located at steep height
review: lot and lots of climb. would not recommend to elders and couples with infants. Even after entering zoo, one needs to climb steep hight to see animals. I had gone with 1.5 years old baby and didn't find it easy and returned after seeing only 2-3 cages.

title: There is nothing to offer at such a high altitude
review: Can go if you are a Bengal Tiger fan, Bear & dear with a lot of birds look alike. Most of them hide in the bushes when you try to see them.

title: Amazing experience
review: The location was awesome.all the animals were well kept and my  favourite was the Bengal tiger.the view of the   breath-taking.

title: Ultimate Experience
review: Zoo is at very high attitude and One may find various varieties of Tigers and Panthers which is main attraction of this Zoo. Really we enjoyed a lot. One must visit this while travelling Nainital.

title: Very high!!
review: excellent view of kumaon hill ranges from the top..but very hectic for old aged people..the two Siberian tigers are very energetic and worth a look at..rest leopard and diffrnt types of birds and all. overall a nice place to go.

title: Visit if your Kids want to, else avoid
review: The Zoo is situated at quite a height, I had bike to reach there not sure if any other facility was available. Too steep road to walk and you would get tired for sure if going by walk.

title: Well maintained zoo
review: Best place to see royal bengal tigers and leopards for them who missed them in Corbett Tiger Reserve or any other protected area.

title: ZOO Visit
review: Fleecing of visitors has become a habit in hill stations every thing is at a premium and MRP is only for print so was the story at the ZOO canteen nothing available at MRP though the zoo was well maintained and got to see various animals

title: A zoo on the top!
review: Dont remember when I last visited a zoo. Hence this experience was very thriling considering I was with my children and the zoo was on the top of the hill. I was glad to see the Tigers, Leopards, Cheetah, Eagles, Monkeys, Birds, Bears....wow!!!

title: Useless
review: Too high and inaccesible, too few animals. Better pass completely. There used to be a snow leopard but it has died. There are few decent birds but not much to enjoy. As hopeless as any other Indian zoo. They should privatize these things or shut them down

title: Different but nice
review: Its unique solely coz its a high altitude zoo. Its a small zoo with not much variety but its nice for the reason that it isn't too crowded & is clean. Its irritating to see people throw stones at animals & that's only because the place doesn't have too many housekeeping guys walking around to manage the place. If i remember correctly, they don't allow cameras inside but we still sneaked ours in to take pictures.

title: Must Visit place in Nainital
review: Well maintained, lots of animals, birds.

title: Amazing zoo
review: This is an amazing zoo to visit. The climb up the slope of the mountain along which the zoo is located is simply exhilarating as well as exhausting. The zoo has a good collection of animals and birds. As the zoo is up on the mountain it also offers an excellent view of the Nainital lake and the city around it. Must see in case you happen to be in Nainital - Hemanta Chandra Bhatt

title: High altitude amazing zoo
review: A very amazing and well kept zoo. Was amazed at the way the zoo is built on such high altitude amongst the hills . Most surprising . The number of animals and the close proximity view was terrific. Due to the height one gets a beautiful view of the naini lake and the city. The well organised guiding arrow mark guide the tourists to see every cage without missing any animal or bird. A must for one to see especially if one is travelling with family and kids. Also do not forget to see the fish pond near the entry/ exit gate

title: must visit
review: we were staying in hotel new bharat which was on zoo road so it was a must to visit the zoo which was walking distance from the hotel

title: Zoo in Nainital
review: Well maintained and good array of fauna to see.. Must visit and appreciate.. Tigers, leopards, barking deers, chimpanzees and lots of birds which are seen mostly in mountains

title: The Nainital Zoo!
review: This Zoo is a must visit in Nainital and is one of the most beautiful natural environments, i have seen in a long time. The Zoo is situated in a very high altitude and climbing up is a task. The Zoo is well maintained and one can see a lot of animals in close proximity. A very good experience.

title: Well maintained, one of the best seen so far
review: Go there to see the magnificent, full size Royal Bengal tiger, the panthers, bear, white peacocks, mesmerizing pheasants and surreal view of Nainital that you will remember for long.

title: Zoo at really high altitude
review: Its a really very nice zoo, but at very high altitude. You have to walk (almost trekk) a lot from the point the cab drops to all the cages. But the animals there are well kept and properly managed.

title: Man eaters home
review: This zoo is home for Siberan tiger, Himalayan Black bear. One have to walk atleast 800 meters to access this zoo. Worth to visit

title: Lost its attraction
review: Lost its attraction after demise of snow leopard. One should feel sorry for the common leopards & tiger for their tiny enclosure. The Himalayan black bear is an attraction.

title: zoo
review: walking so much for a mere visit to the zoo was disappointing as there were no animals in the zoo. the siberian tiger is long dead and there is not much to find in the zoo. so ask for the zoo animals before going there.

title: very tiring
review: the zoo is at a height. but u hv to walk a LOT,which is difficult due to steep roads. also there r not many animals.go only if u hv lot of stamina n really want to see the animals.

title: good zoo
review: its a good zoo to see lot of wild animal Tigers , leopards , beer , deer etc.  plenty of birds. its a very well mentioned , good cleaning , arrow direction given on the floor to give a path to visit various area of zoo. Worth to viist Zoo . My hotel is @ 1/2 a kilometer from Zoo.

title: Not bad for 50 rupees
review: We liked the fact that the zoo charged foreigners the same entry fee as Indian nationals. The leopards were very impressive and had a large, natural looking enclosure - they perhaps benefitted from being sponsored by the local bank. The eagles, while being very impressive birds, were cooped up in a tiny cage with little room to fly. The zoo is up at the top of a narrow road, the upper stretches of which are forbidden to cars. While this wasn't a problem for us, it may restrict access to the elderly or those with young children.

title: Best Zoo in India
review: Very spacious zoo, hygenic, forest like ambiense for the animals. Lively and healthy animals unlike other Zoos. (We have seen the Zoo in Chennai, Bangalore, Pune, Jaipur) this is the best.

title: Well maintained Zoo...
review: Well maintained, clean zoo. Must visit place in Nainital not only for children but for all. It opens at 10 a.m. From mall road Zoo Jeeps are available for dropping to Zoo. Even from dropping point zoo is nearly 10 minutes up hill walking road distance.As we do not have practice we find it difficult to walk over. But once you reach there, you enjoy watching Bengal Tigers, Leopards, Deer, white peacock, variety beautiful birds. Two good restaurants are there for refreshing yourself. Over all enjoyed trip there.

title: High altitude, picturesque , spacious zoo..worth a visit
review: I have been to Nainital many times..but never even thought of going to zoo..This time , it was highly recommended by a friend and decided to go..Well, it was a pleasant surprise. One of the cleanest,spacious zoo i have seen. It's on a height and gives you a beautiful view of complete Nainital. Seeing Bengal tiger, especially after having seen Life of Pi movie, bought lots of memories. Lots of open space, variety of birds,animals and above all, high degree of hygiene..I recommend this highly especially if you are travelling with kids

title: This zoo is a good one, well-stocked, well-maintained, worth the visit
review: nice zoo so to say, ive added 2 pics, a good number of species of birds and animals, and a great pair of roaring royal bengal tigers being the star attraction. Shuttle service (shared sumos) available from Mallital end of lake take you and drop you up there (5mins more to walk up to the ticket counter, rs.50 per head), and you can take back any shuttle for your return back, all in Rs30/- per person (as of April'2013). The zoo road branches off the Mall Road, 100m ahead of Hotel Alka. But its a steep climb, and difficult with small kids, so better take the shuttle service. For sure the kids would enjoy. Cannot takeany foodstuff inside the zoo. A small chai-maggi shop is there outside at the ticket counter. Washroom is avl.

title: A zoo like no other!
review: My kid loved this place , though one needs to walk a lot and seriously it is walk since the zoo is pretty high up and a steep walk it is! But apart from that well kept place with quite a good collection of animals!

title: Too much walking for too little
review: This zoo is sitauted at a very high altitute and visitng it is a project in itself. Zoo shuttle will take you to the zoo gate in few minutes but even then one has to trek to a great height to enter the zoo. Then to view animals one has to trek a lot. However one can find tiger,leopards,bears,deers, birds and monkeys. There was no siberian tiger as advertised. It is a good time pass visit especially for kids but be prepared to walk a lot and that too at great heights.

title: Tiger viewing at best
review: those who could not see tigers at Corbett can get some satisfaction by seeing them at this zoo...leopards are also good..

title: Simply Amazing
review: Must visit place in Nainital. Specially if visiting with Children. Very large number of animals are kept in this zoo and very well maintained.

title: Amazing, Must Visit if you are in Nainital.
review: Pandit Govind Ballabh Pant High Altitude Zoo is must in Nainital. It is located on Zoo Road, quite a climb from Tal, but shuttle service is available from the tal. Entry to the zoo is Rs.50.

title: Great Expereince
review: The zoo is great and people who have courage to do treking should only go. Other older people who cannot walk much should avoid zoo. It realy great fun. The animals are also worth a see.

title: Best zoo in India. CANNOT BE MISSED
review: The location of the zoo cannot be any better. You cannot find any better zoo in India. It has trekking experience written all over it. Animals in the zoo are really healthy and ale that you can see that the staff must be taking good care of them.

title: Good number of animals
review: It is very hard to trek 1 km from the down. It is not good that the local vehicles only allowed to go to zoo road and even they drop half a KM before the zoo.

title: nice and small
review: The Nainital Zoo is simply beautiful. It has many birds and animals like porcupine (a rare sight), musk deer, some migratory birds and the White and the Royal Bengal Tiger. The views from the zoo to the Kumaon Hills are awesome and breath taking. The zoo is clean and maintained. It is situated on the Zoo Road. It is a must visit.

title: Trekkers zoo..
review: It is a unique zoo situated at high altitude.  I was excited and found interesting as I love to trek. Streets approaching to zoo and car journey to it will be unforgettable experience. But if you have elders with joint pains and little kids you shall have to think twice before venturing.

title: Nothing great!
review: You would see many more animals in other zoos. And it's located in such a height. You gotta be he fit to go around in the zoo. Every animal is located in different heights. The only beauty was we could get a wonderful top view of the Nainital.

title: Fun for Kids
review: Its one of the high altitude zoo. The roads inside zoo is like climbing hill. Many animals and himalyan birds and trees can be found there.

title: Surprise package
review: Our family visited this zoo in the month of OCt 2011. This zoo is slightly away from the main lake and on a hill sorrounding Nainital. Right from the entrance, it is a uphill road, which spirals inside the zoo. Roaming around includes, climbing the hill. What is very good about the zoo is the cleanliness and well kept cages. It has a royal bengal tiger, deers, various birds, bears and one gets excellent view of Nainital from the top.  Word of caution, it may be tiring for most of the people to roam around in the zoo as it involves, climbing the hill. However, it is worth a visit and enjoyable for a family

title: One of the best Zoos in India
review: This is one of the best zoo that i have ever seen.Unique about this zoo is the way you climb to see the zoo its tough but you will enjoy it.There are well maintained Royal Bengal Tigers and Stlylish Leopards with many interesting animals.Lots of Birds.Walking inside the zoo is really enjoyable.

title: Great Place
review: To see himalayan wildlife it is great place but it demands a resolution as one have to walk at least 1-1.5 kms on up hill and  down hill slope

title: Don't Miss this if you are in Nainital
review: I have been to many zoo's across the world, but this was unique & wonderful experience for me & family... first time to high altitude zoo, inside the zoo walking around from one cage to the other cage was great fun .. we had to climb the altitude to reach from one cage to another this gave birds view to see some of the wild animal. Zoo is well maintained, neat and clean. Most of the animals when i went was dozing around. a must visit when u are in Nainital.

title: Nice Place
review: Its very nice to hear that a Good Zoo well maintained is available for your visit with sufficient number of birds and animals in it.  A temple deep inside the zoo is also good to see.

title: Best Zoo in Hills
review: It is really a great place to visit in nainitaal

title: Not much White peacock and Leopards are the attraction
review: There are two white peacocks, leopards, bengal tigers, so many birds, some deer thats all. You get to see some Wolf that looks like dog.

title: zoo on the top
review: kids enjoy it alot but do remember its quite a good climb and there is no easy other way to reach here but to walk on its own. tigers and leopard are in abundance

title: not a typical zoo
review: Loved royal bengal tiger in its full splendour.bird watching is too good, a place to go specially if one have interes in wild life

title: Binsar Wildlife Sanctuary
review: Very Green Bushes and great Plants and Birds. Unfortunately, no wildlife animals on display. The roads inside the sanctuary are well maintained but unless proper care is taken, wildlife sanctuary will only remain a Bird Sanctuary.

title: not very good
review: since it was very near to the hotel we went there a lot of uphill climb after the gate there should be some car service as going up is very difficult animals are also less as we had expected

title: nice
review: you will get down there from tourist operator. Different type of animals, birds you can see. most of them may be from himalaya only

title: A bevy of animals
review: THis place is high up in the sky with a variety of animals. There are  big birds and big cats. I like to way the animals are maintained and the weather is pleasant for animal watching.

title: best best best
review: beautifully landscaped v close to nature full of greenery v well maintained neat and clean must for children and adult alike

title: Zero point
review: the walk uphill is quite treacherous and coming down downhill is also quite risky. but worth the trouble of reaching the top. If you are lucky you can witness snowfall at the top

title: good
review: You have to walk uphill. keep going. its worth it! Its the only high altitude zoo in India. Birds are kept well. zoo id clean and well maintained.

title: A Refreshing Experience at the Zoo
review: Its been many years since i had been to the zoo. To my surprise Nainital Zoo was a refreshing experience. Even though it houses only a handful of animals,being at an the higher altitude gives one a nice feeling. The roar of the tiger echoes between the hills, giving one goosebumps. The birds here are chirpy making one feel that they are talking among themselves.

title: Must visit place for you and your kids in Nainital
review: You will not find a more clean and neat zoo than this zoo. Ultra clean and the variety of animals is fantastic. Though the steep distance is a worry for elders and the shuttle service needs to be managed better, the upkeep of animals and their living cages is commendable.

title: Nice though requires a lot of walking
review: Must do though you might get stuck as there are only 6 cabs that take you up there and bring you back...Walking down is easy though...

title: Nice one
review: The animals looked healthy and well kept..  tigers and leopards can be seen from real close quarters. There are many varietes of deers and birds. However the zoo does not have provision for water and lavatories at proper intervals. There could be some provision of guides as well. But overall a nice one!

title: Better than Delhi zoo
review: Well designed and well kept. Since it is a high altitude zoo it has many steps to climb and many slopes to scale, so be full of energy. There are people constantly sweeping the paths clean. However what I could not understand is that why the toilets are so awfully neglected.

title: Naintal Zoo visit
review: Best view of tigers and Leopards I have ever seen.  Animals look healthy and well taken cared. Slightly difficult climb and walk but was worth a visit. Taxi Vendor who ferry passengers to the ZOO are very rude like all other Taxi guys in Nainital. One learns to live with that.

title: A must visit in Nainital, esp if you are with kids
review: A very unique zoo.  You approach it by taking a shared jeep operated from mall road.  You trek even more to get to the zoo and on the zoo grounds, but the relatively small zoo in its natural setting offers a great view of regional wildlife as well some breathtaking views of Nainital itself.

title: good place
review: u have to either walk or wait for the special taxi, no private vehicle allowed, not a big zoo but still a nice place for time pass.

title: High alltitude - u need to be fit
review: The zoo was good, just like any other zoo and the whole Mall Road and the Naini lake were visible from it resembling tiny showpieces.

title: Interesting!
review: Located on the hill top, an interesting place to visit with kids. It’s around 30 minutes walk from Tallital Rickshaw stand. Taxis are available. Avoid taking your own car, as the road is steep, as well as, narrow and the parking virtually non-existent.

title: Good
review: Its not the best zoo in the world but is a attraction specially if you are with kids, they will love it. So if you run out of all the tourist spots in nainital then worth a visit.

title: A nice place to stretch yourself
review: The zoo is well located, just off the Mall road and Naini Lake. However the approach is very steep and you may require some extra effort to reach the gates.

title: Nainital Zoo
review: Good Zoo to visit, Bengal Tiger are really good to see and looks very healthy, most difficult as you need to climb a lot and once you have completed the visit the only way left is to goto hotel and take rest. Its very difficult to see a Zoo on that height. Well maintained and very clean and most important that all animal or birds looks very healthy and active. Kids will love to see but after sometime beready to carry them as they will be too tired. Good place to visit.

title: Fun
review: Enjoyed the zoo, but it's quite the hike. We weren't quite sure if it was a zoo of high altitude animals or just a zoo at high altitude. Had some fun animals, way too many pheasants.

title: Badly maintained
review: We had a terrible journey up to the zoo in the disorganised Govt jeeps.  At the zoo, there were very few people to supervise and many visitors were feeding the animals or teasing them.  Very upsetting to see.  Sign posts were wrong.

title: best
review: royal bengal tiger n other animals......good place .......................

title: A healthy and clean zoo
review: A really good, well maintained, clean zoo. Only adverse fact is you have to climb a lot on hilly slopes, and with kids it becomes different. But they have a good collection, royal bengal tigers, leopards, plenty of birds...... and all of them in good, healthy conditions and within clean rooms. Must see if you have a kid.

title: If u enjoy hiking this is the place.
review: its just the altitude which would make you feel happy. The royal Bengal tiger is very beautiful and healthy

title: Quite high and steep
review: Like- Very nicely kept

title: very nice and spacious zoo
review: we did not expect this kind of zoo in Nainital. When we go there we expect a zoo with small cages for the animals and in bad shape. But is wan't that. The zoo is very spacious and the most animals have enough space in this zoo. Animals look in good shape and you find a nice variety of mountain animals of India. Fee is 30 rs an 20 rs for each camera. it is the first high altitude zoo i visit. Nice for children and adults. You have to climb a little in this zoo. You can come there by walk. 25-35 minutes steep climb. A taxi is about 75 rs. Walk back to Nainital is much easier an took 15 minutes.

title: One of the best Zoos in INDIA... Clean, Beautiful, unforgetable...!!!
review: I and wife visited this Zoo last October and we liked it very very much... everything about this zoo is just perfect...

title: A rare zoo at such high altitude
review: The Nainital Zoo took us by surprise. Never expected it to be such a great experience. We walked all the way to the zoo, which was bit tiring. But every bit of that hardship was worth it. The zoo was clean  and very well maintained. However there was lack of security staff. Some stupid people took this advantage and fed the animals and were also poking them with sticks. There were not too much of wild animals, but all of them were healthy. You
